results.description:
Our Founding Visionary, Lady Joy and Team share life coaching resources to inspire, empower and equip women to be one heart with Christ; coaching women into deeper dimensions of Godly wisdom and understanding. These life coaching resources are divinely inspired by the Holy Spirit to help you overcome life's challenges. Proverbs 4:7 says, "Wisdom is the principle thing, therefore get wisdom; and in all your getting, get understanding. All women who desire to be transformed in the image and likeness of God's heart are welcome to join! Be blessed and grow in faith as you experience Lady Joy's life coaching products and services!  Let Lady Joy help you understand the details of God's grace in your life, family, ministry and business. 

As Lady Joy provides monthly life coaching resources to women, she has the pleasure of inspiring, empowering, equipping and connecting Virtuous Women's Lounge members with a larger community of virtuous women who attend our conferences, workshops and retreats. Our Virtuous Women's Lounge events provide fellowship opportunities by connecting like minded women of faith; where they will cultivate and establish authentic relationships within our Virtuous Women's Lounge community of "sister" girlfriends. 

Join Today and become a member! 

Inclusive are some of the following Virtuous Women's Lounge Member Benefits: 

* Receive Lady Joy's monthly life coaching videos that will inspire you, empower you and equip you to be one with God's heart.

* Invitation to experience transformational one on one life coaching from your Chapter's Life Stylist Coach

* Access to "Pursuit To Wholeness" Course #1 life coaching audios from our VWL Member Resource Library of life coaching audios created to inspire, empower and equip you to be whole in Christ.

* Style Watch Award Certificate & Luncheon Invitation held to welcome new members who completed Course One in our "Pursuit To Wholeness" Life Coaching Series

* Tune In & Listen In On "Secrets Of A Life Stylist Coach" with Lady Joy Blog Talk Radio

* Receive The New Lifestyle Choice Online Magazine article updates & Intimate Conversations Interviews

* FREE Or Reduced Rates On Conferences & Workshops

* Join our growing Virtuous Women's Lounge community as you enjoy authentic fellowship with Virtuous Women's Lounge "Sister" Girlfriends

* Invitation to attend "Sister Girlfriends In Purpose" annual retreat to revitalize, rejuvenate and renew your mind, spirit, soul & body 

* Eligible to connect and volunteer as a Virtuous Women's Lounge event hostess in your city

* AND MORE TO COME AS WE EXPAND FOR THE GLORY OF GOD!

Criteria For Membership:

STEP ONE: Commit And Be In Agreement With Virtuous Women's Lounge Promise Of Faith 
STEP TWO: Fill Out New Membership Registration Below 

STEP THREE: Pay the annual membership fee of $31.00 

STEP FOUR: Stay connected by attending a minimum of one (1) in person event every (3) months and one (1) online  event every month 
STEP FIVE: Spread the word and invite other women who are ready to seek God with all their mind, spirit, soul and body!

STEP SIX:  Complete New Members Orientation & "Pursuit To Wholeness" Life Coaching Course #1 

STEP SEVEN: Contact Us and find out how you can start a Virtuous Women's Lounge Ministry Group as an Event Host!

results.description:
The Mission of New Jersey City University Toastmasters

The mission of the NJCU Toastmasters Club is to provide a mutually supportive and positive learning environment in which every member has the opportunity to develop communication and leadership skills, which in turn foster self-confidence and personal growth.

NJCU Toastmasters can benefit you in the following ways:

     conduct more effective meetings

     give better presentations

     hone management skills

     work better with fellow employees

     offer constructive criticism

     accept criticism more objectively

New Jersey City University Toastmasters Club was chartered on October 2005.  The club meets weekly on the distinguished campus of New Jersey City University (NJCU)  We meet every Wednesday at 12 noon in Hepburn Hall Room 104.

Members of the club represent all four of the University's divisions.  From entry-level support staff members to senior managers with decades of work experience, these members recognize that Toastmaster's provides a wonderful opportunity for professional development.  Cultural diversity is a hallmark characteristic of Jersey City and NJCU, and this diversity is certainly evident at NJCU Toastmasters.

Membership is open to NJCU employees, faculty, students, alumni and anyone interested in challenging themselves as they grow into the speakers they want to become.  Come join us and enjoy the Toastmasters' experience.
results.name: New Jersey City Toastmasters Meetup

results.description:
SanctuarySundays:  Meetup group for  Men (of Color) to Men (Gay men, SGL men, MSM men, Bi, Straight men) who want to connect with other quality men in a relaxed social environment that is not a sex club. A program of Adam Alpha Omega Men's Social Health Club.   We are building SanctuarySundays to be a  gathering for men seeking an alternative to bars and sex clubs.  Light dinner conversation, group activities, karaoke, wii, cards, board games, etc.  This is a smoke, drug, and alcohol free space.  As importantly, this is a negativity-free space.  We are developing this as a community project.  We need your help.

Adam Alpha Omega is the men's group of KÒèx  committee (Sexuality from the *core) of  Humanity Evolution Movement.org.  KÒèx is a call-out to members of the sexuality community (LGBT-TS-SGL-Q-S) to join the conversation connecting their sexuality to humanity evolution. KÒbonee-120 is the Black men's group within KÒèx 

The vision of KÒèx is the development of a community of women and men who function from their core in the context of their sexuality (ies) so that they can make more powerful life choices. and  catalyze the transformation of the sexuality community and culture, and provide leadership in the evolution of humanity.  We have human TECHNOLOGY. We have methodology. 

 *KÒ/Core= that part of us which connects us with each other, and with the rest of the universe.
results.name: Sanctuary Sundays, KÒèbonee-120,  Adam Alpha Omega, and KÒèx

results.description:
Travel to Costa Rica the right way .
Whether you like to travel alone and or in a group , this group offers you both yet maximizing the economies of scale that group rates offers.

I have been traveling to Costa Rica continually for over 30 years , and it upsets me how many people go there and miss its majestic natural beauty, they miss connecting with the local population , miss the opportunity to more intimately get to know the culture , their great variety of fruit and vegetables , local markets ,local festivities, local restaurants.
I INVITE YOU TO VISIT COSTA RICA and feel as if you lived in Costa Rica for few days .

Over 25 % of its land set aside for conservation.
The literacy rate is above 92%.
Education is free and compulsory up to high school
Costa Rica has 58 micro-climates.
In it, it holds almost 5 % of the different forms of life of the planet in only 0.003% of the world's territory.
If you wish, you can see tropical dry forest, tropical rain forest and tropical cloud forest in one day, you can do so here but again, why hurry.
It has over 250 volcanoes, four of which are active, including Central America's most active one.
A quick and dirty on Costa Rica is the following: To the North east it is like the little amazons of Costa Rica, to the south east it is like the little Jamaica of Costa Rica, to the south west, it is like Tarzan's movies, to the North West, it is like the little California of Costa Rica.
There are 856 species of birds, which is over a hundred more than the continental US Mexico and Canada put together.
There are more butterfly species than in all of Africa.
From the capital you can drive to the Caribbean sea and to the pacific ocean in one day but again, why hurry.
results.name: Travel to Costa Rica

topics.name: Your Role in Addressing Climate Change

results.description:
Citizens Climate Lobby (citizensclimatelobby.org) is a non-partisan group of climate activists that is creating the political will for a livable world by empowering individuals to experience breakthroughs in exercising their personal and political power.

We meet to to educate ourselves on climate issues and the legislative process, and lobby Congress to enact a specific piece of climate legislation that will grow the economy, add jobs, increase our competitiveness with China, and clean our air and water. We also engage with the media by writing letters to editors, as well as host educational events for local organizations.

We are looking for an additional leader to help co-lead this group.  If you are interested in taking a leadership role, please contact Klaus Rittenbach and Steve Ramshur. 

Free introductory conference call for new members:  Every Wednesday evening, 8-9 pm: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/

The New Jersey LGBT Chamber of Commerce is New Jersey's premier organization for the promotion of LGBT owned businesses, LGBT business enterprise certification opportunities (LGBTBE), and the advancement of LGBT business professionals.  

We are proud to serve as the New Jersey affiliate chapter of the National Gay & Lesbian Chamber of Commerce (NGLCC) based in Washington, DC. You should attend our networking events, workshops and panel discussions to grow your business, widen your knowledge base and expand your social circle, within the community and beyond.  Experience the power of membership. Become a chamber member today and apply for LGBT business certification.  

The NGLCC is the exclusive, third-party certification body that verifies that eligible businesses are majority-owned by LGBT individuals, and subsequently grants LGBT Business Enterprise® (LGBTBE®) designation to such businesses as part of its LGBT Supplier Diversity Initiative.  By becoming a certified LGBTBE, businesses are able to build relationships with America's leading corporations, generate prospective business and clients, and collectively team with each other for contracting opportunities. As corporate America becomes more inclusive and further diversifies its supply chain, certification offers the opportunity for LGBT-owned businesses to differentiate themselves from their competitors.
results.name: New Jersey LGBT Chamber of Commerce

Are you having difficulties creating good photographs? Do you want to be a part of a community that is social, and supportive? Then this group is for you. Learn to set your camera, and utilize it; learn to see light, and control it; and learn to pose models, before you click it. Just like driving a car it becomes second nature over time, but you must practice, practice, practice!

What I learn I like to share with others, because it helps me become a better photographer. We can all learn from each other, share tips, and support each other in our efforts to become better photographers. If you don't try, you can't fail, and if you don't fail, you can't learn. Let's get together and make it happen! Join us for events, and 1 on 1 sessions; we will be visiting various locations in NYC, as well as participate in seminars, and exhibitions.

This group is fee-based (pay-to-play), because I want you to invest in this group, and what we are doing. If you value something that someone is doing, you will reward that person. Fees paid also serve as motivation for me to be more creative, and put forth more effort to give you your monies worth, because I know that someone wants the service. This also compels you to be more attentive to me as you expect your monies worth.

I am not in the business of collecting members. If you are in the business of playing games, don't waste my time, and test my patience. Don't waste your time. Behave with purpose, go places, do things, and meet others. I want you to value yourself. Join me, and let's work to make this group great, for everyone! See you soon...

results.description:
Come Ye - Coders, Developers, DevOps, Powershell enthusiasts, and lovers of automation !!

If you work with Microsoft Windows, this is the meetup for you. We are PowerShell experts teaching how to leverage this automation platform in your enterprise.

Every month we have speakers who will present on topics designed to help you improve your knowledge and skills in PowerShell.

Monthly Calendar
We usually meet once every month, on the 2nd calendar Monday at Microsoft 11, Times Square Office. At times, we do make last minute schedule changes to accommodate a VIP speaker, or a Powershell MVP visiting New York.

Tentative Schedule
- 6:00-6:30 PM - Pizzas and catch-up, sponsored by Sapien (www.sapien.com)
- 6:30-8:00 PM - Powershell talks
- 8:00 PM onwards - We usually grab drinks at Heartland Brewery across the street.

Technical level of content
This is an oft repeated question, and here is our take on it.

We subscribe to the sentiments of Antoine de Saint-Exupery, when it comes to choosing topics and speakers for a user-group talk.

"If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea."

We do cover beginner and intermediate topics. We also revisit a few topics which we might have covered in the past. However, we strive to focus on the "new and cool" stuff in the Powershell ecosystem.

You also get the added benefit of having 2 Powershell MVP's in the house - Tome Tanasovski and Doug Finke. They would love to answer any questions you may have on Powershell or the meaning of life.
results.name: PowerShell Meetup

Quick Summary:

We are looking for ambitious comedians, rapper, singers, dancers, actors, actresses, musicians, & models for our bi-weekly Youtube Web Series about bad bankers and their customers. This is a great opportunity to get noticed.  You can come on just to make a cameo appearance or be a regular ongoing member of the series.

Ideal members for our Meetup:

We are looking for ambitious members who are excited to be a part of our team.  You ideally want to produce, act, edit, be a part of, or start your own youtube channel and really like the FinQi cause. 

About the Series:

The series will be heavily promoted by FinQi, a free service provided to the community to make banks pay you & reverse all bank fees.  As a potential result of the promotion & strong story appeal to local and national media.  There is a strong possibility some of the people involved can really see a boost in their careers.    The scripts are great, we just need the right talent. This Youtube Web Series is aiming to be controversial, funny, fun, & extremely entertaining.

About FinQi:

If have an strong interest in morality and good for the overall public & prefer to spend your money on vacations, fun, & not banks you are a FinQi person.  We are not occupy wall street though.  Our aim is detailed on making banks follow our rules.  None of our members pay fees and are instead our members banks pay our members to do every day banking.  The rest of the public can get abused by big banks to the point that if you are watching it for entertainment and get a tub of popcorn you can be in for some big laughs.

If you have been an angry bank customer, ex- personal banker, ex-business banker, or financial advisor or are familiar with how the media characterizes the shady world of banking you may fall in love with us.  

If Interested:

Please send your portfolio, resume, reel, demo, photo or a link to your works or why you are interested. 

Bi-Weekly Meetups:

We will be meeting at least once every 2 weeks.

results.description: Go Eat Give is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting peace and understanding by advancing cultural awareness through food, travel, and community service. Go Eat Give offers unique international vacations featuring authentic, immersive experiences with local people, cultures, and cuisines. By partnering with community organizations abroad, Go Eat Give raises global awareness of important issues and provides meaningful support to local nonprofits, including orphanages, schools, health centers, food programs, and women's empowerment centers. Go Eat Give holds Destination Dinner at consulates, cultural centers and local restaurant in New York City areas to raise awareness about a particular country. We showcase restaurants that serve authentic cuisine from the country, speakers that share knowledge of the country's customs and practices, artists that educate participants on the local culture. For more information, visit us on www.goeatgive.org

results.description:
We have come to remember who we are. We have come to reclaim the power within, to live in the fullness of our true being. We have come to live in joy. My vision in gathering you all together here is not only to support our healing journeys with sacred plant medicines but also to bring what we have learned and remembered via these journeys back to the real world, to our everyday lives. In my eyes this work is about coming to a place where we find the ceremony in our everyday life, in every step, every moment, every word, and every thought, with or without the medicine.

Those with any experience in this world of plants and shamanism have heard the word “integration” and how important it is in this work. But what does “integration” mean? How do we integrate and apply our inner wisdom to the happenings around and within us? How do we dissolve the seeming separation between the world of spirit and the “real world”?

I am here simply to share with you my knowledge and experience and to create safe, sacred space for each of you to reconnect to the medicine/answers/wisdom/truth within yourselves and with each other. I offer you a connection to a community of like-hearted beings who are offering their wisdom and tools to advance the whole on this path of awakening.

I believe in transparency and honesty because we all carry the medicine within. Each of us has a unique and equally important gift to offer. Everyone has vision. Everyone holds a special space in the circle of ceremony, in the larger circle that is Life.
There are no secrets on the path to awakening. There is only truth, and that truth is for everyone to share.

I envision a life for myself and others where we wake up each day feeling connected, guided and at ease. Feeling real and true to who we are and what is passing through us. Feeling clear and with a sense of purpose.
I envision a life of being awake. Awake all the time, not just when working with the medicines. Living the awakeness to the Truth. The Truth that: I AM Whole, I AM Love, I AM Free. 

What will be offered?: 

-We will come together as a community to learn about and share our experiences with sacred plants and to share our work and gifts with others.  This can happen both online via webinars and in-person via live events and workshops.
-Webinars to prepare participants before medicine ceremonies so they feel grounded, open and at ease before arriving at the ceremony. We will do group meditations, review the preparation recommendations and ask questions to express and clear up any potential confusion or concerns.
-Webinars to integrate after the ceremonies. We will do group meditations, share our personal experiences, offer tools and exercises that can be done daily to assist the unfolding of what you experienced with the medicine, and answer any questions participants may have.
-Alternate resources that have powerful healing tools that can be practiced daily to continue the awakening process in our everyday life or between the ceremonies.
-Opportunities to connect one-on-one or in a group setting to catalyze personal healing.
-Access to virtual and live events all over the United States and Canada.
-Access to shamanic and energy healing practitioners.
-Access to educational information about healing plants, foods, and products.
-A place to be heard, seen, and supported.

Who am I?
My name is Rachael Devon Rios Sessions. I have come to this work via my own transformational journey and self-seeking. I began my work with the medicine about 6 years ago. I dove in head first after my first ceremony experience, which awakened within me an undeniable knowing that my work with sacred plants was much bigger than my own. I have worked with many wonderful teachers, but my most profound teachers to date have been my late-husband Ramon Orlando and our two beautiful boys, Rafael and Rey. Ramon passed away suddenly in his home country of Colombia last year but continues his work as shaman and taita (teacher) from the world of spirit. We shared many dreams for the expansion of the work with these sacred tools as a vehicle for the awakening of every being. I aim to humbly continue the work we began together and I trust in the guidance and vision I am offered. Besides being a full-time mama, I am a facilitator and organizer of sacred ceremony as well as a shamanic practitioner, Reiki master, yoga teacher and BodyTalk practitioner.
results.name: AYAM Healing with Plants

Each Meetup will involve some combination of meditation, mantra, and prayer and discussion of contemporary spiritual teachings by Mata Amritanandamayi (Amma), Mirabai Devi, Eckhart Tolle, Neale Donald Walsch, Paul Selig, Marianne Williamson, and others. The goal is to promote an understanding of how we can develop unconditional love for ourselves and for all humanity. Spiritual growth never happens in isolation -- only by working with others.

results.description:
As a child, I spent much of my life outdoors.  Whether in a backyard or campground, many of my fondest memories have something to do with being outside.  Now with a family of my own, I cant help but notice how much time our digital devices consume us on a daily basis.  Don't get me wrong, I'm a self proclaimed tech junkie.  Like many of you, my cell phone is attached to my hip, whether for professional or personal reasons.

I created this Meetup to encourage people to reconnect with the great outdoors. So if you are into hiking, biking, geocaching, fishing, camping or anything else that involves being outside, you'll find someone here with similar interests. Activities will be appropriate for beginner and intermediate levels.  We won't be cliff jumping off the Grand Canyon (yet).  This is a family friendly Meetup, so if you have kids, please bring them along too!

You do not have to be from the West Essex region to join us.  In fact, we encourage outsiders to join us and introduce us to some of their local gems!

This Meetup is family run.  We are not a company and are not affiliated with any company.  Sponsor's have agreed to assist us with our Meetup and event fees in return for promotional visibility.

results.description:
This is a group for people who love all things Italian... enough to actually travel to Italy.  And not just the Rome/Florence/Venice triumvirate (though I visit and love all those cities).  I'm talking about UNDISCOVERED Italy... the destinations that are not so common, but oh, so amazing...

We'll be developing trips and opportunities for cultural exchange that are off the beaten path. Rome, Florence and Venice are wonderful, but there are so many other interesting, beautiful and delicious destinations to explore. 

You should join this group if you're serious about participating.  And likewise, if you plan to click "Join" and never do a thing about it, then you should probably pass us by.  I've organized a number of Meetup groups, and the biggest problem is lack of accountability among members.  In this group, if you RSVP but never follow up, or if you ignore communications that are directed at your personally, you will not be allowed to continue in the group. Sorry to be a hard ass, but it's not fair to the group to carry dead weight.

The good news it that some members are amazing, and we've been able to create some amazing experiences here in Italy.  As a result, I actually live in Italy for a good part of the year, and I'd love it if more Americans discovered some of the wonderful places and people that have drawn me to this amazing country! Join us... it will be a great adventure.
results.name: Americans Exploring Italy: Culture, Food, Friendship & More

results.description:
This is an accountability group for business owners that are looking for support to help achieve their latest goals for growth.

Guidelines:

1.  Each member should choose and commit to a discreet and measurable goal for each quarter. The goal should follow the SMARTER guideline:

S - Specific

M - Measureable

A - Actionable

R - Relevant/Realistic

T - Time Bound (3 months)

E - Ethical

R – Resourced


2.  Each member must commit to bi-weekly in person meetings and alternate weekly phone bridge communications.


3.  Each member must be read to actively participate and contribute to the group.
results.name: New York Business Accountability Group Meetup

results.description:
Football for Change (F4C) is a 3v3 recreational football (soccer) league, a social movement and business dedicated to use football as a tool for change with the ultimate goal of creating an alternative to FIFA.  Right now, we are looking for captains of teams for the first 3v3 league of F4C in Brooklyn at the Prospect Park to start on September 13th. Meanwhile, we are meeting for free pre-season games sessions.

The league will run for at least 8 weeks. It is planned to have at least 8 teams with 6 players each, who play on Sundays two 25-mins games. Besides the game, team members and friends will be encouraged to support a suggested social cause and engage in an after-game conversation about social impact and other topics of interest.

EVERYBODY is welcome!

This is the deal for this season: team of 6 players + 14 games in 8 weeks + social impact = $500

Includes: NYC Parks permit, soccer balls & goals 

Our core value is trust, we believe it is the foundation of a strong society. F4C's finances will be published for transparency and educational purposes. 

If you want to become a captain or register your team for the F4C's Brooklyn league, you can make your payment through Paypal to change4football@gmail.com

As part of our sales strategy there will be advertising efforts to find players for the league, however there is a special superpower in the word of mouth that makes it the most powerful marketing technique. Let's make this happen!

Connect with us on Facebook & Twitter, spread the word!

 See you in the field.-

Loló & Leo
results.name: Brooklyn Sundays 3v3 Soccer League

results.description:
The purpose of our group is to encourage it's members to live a “regret-less" life.

Are you stuck in a rut?  Cant forgive someone?  Not getting over your last breakup?

At Y'NEVANO meeting and events, the conversations encourage you to practice living with a "You never know" state of mind.  What if you act on your ambitions, position yourself to hit your targets and adopt the spirit of an achiever? Because, Y'NEVANO.

Comedians Wali Collins and Annie Gambina have teamed up to facilitate fun, impactful, interactive workshops.  Enjoyable exercises and conversations demonstrate how to handle stress, be happier and live without regrets.

Wali Collins, Author, Comedian, Actor:  Working as an Architect, the calling for show business was very strong.  Wali’s mother encouraged him to pursue stand-up comedy and gave him the best piece of advice. She simply said, "you never know."

Wali Collins is a regular at all of the main stream Comedy clubs in the United States.  He has traveled the world, hosted TV shows, and had the honor of performing for two American presidents.  Wali is also the most sought after comedian for corporate events.  Wali has succeeded at all facets of life.  He feels a responsibility to share Y’NEVANO with the world.

Annie Gambina, Trainer, Life Coach, Comedian:  Having spent her career in the field of training and personal development, Annie has facilitated workshops for children as young as 4 through adults in retirement in areas such as personal productivity, stress management, forgiveness and abduction prevention, just to name a few.  Her  passion is to have people she comes in contact with realize how they are special and unique and to uncover hidden talents.
results.name: Y'NEVANO Achievers & Doers

results.description:
This group is for those who want to take 100% responsibility for their own health. It is for those who are sick and tired of being sick and tired. If you are interested in a self-directed approach to your own healthcare, this is the place for you. 

       There are healthcare providers everywhere who cure "incurable" diseases hundreds an thousands of times a year. They can reproduce their results anytime with virtually anyone. We are here to expose you to some of them and their knowledge. If you or a loved one have a particular medical condition and want a different opinion and perspective, join our group.

       We offer no medical advice and have nothing to sell, but we are here to discuss perspectives of health and talk about different opinions that alternative healthcare practitioners have. 

       Our group learns from one another and supports each other. We are here to exchange ideas and share experiences of what works for us and what does not. Some member may know of accomplished alternative healthcare practitioners with a great track record. Others may know websites that have specific information that another member may need.

       We are here to facilitate conversation and exchange ideas for the benefit of all. Feel free to go into our  "Discussion" section for a better idea of what we are about.

Thank you.
results.name: When Traditional Medicine Fails -- North Jersey

results.description:
We practice mindfulness meditation and principally follow the Zen tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We also explore the wisdom from other wonderful teachers.

Cultivating mindfulness means paying attention to what is going on inside of us and around us. Too often we live in forgetfulness - our body is in one place but our mind is lost somewhere else. When we bring mindfulness into our everyday life - to our thoughts, emotions, speech and actions - we are able to embrace all aspects of ourselves, better able to deal with anger and other negative emotions, and can experience life more fully.

www.facebook.com/SunOfAwareness

We meet regularly on Sunday mornings, 9:00-10:30am, at Yoga Shunya studio: 275 Grove Street, 3rd Floor (across from City Hall).

Beginning meditators - and those with no experience - are always welcome. Donation is optional ($5-10 suggested) to support the yoga studio. Cushions, mats, and chairs are all provided. Just wear comfortable clothes for sitting and walking!

Come whenever you can -- We'd love to meet you!

==========================================================

Note: While our group is new on Meetup, we have been gathering regularly since 2009. And now we're focused on letting more people know about us!
results.name: Sun of Awareness - Mindfulness Meditation in Jersey City

results.description:
WHY TOASTMASTERS? 

Today’s business environment is more competitive than ever. Technical skills no longer determine who sets the pace. It’s strong communication and leadership skills that will push you to the front of the pack. 

These are skills you can refine as a member of a Toastmasters club. And best of all, since it is a mutually supportive and positive learning environment, protective gear is not necessary.

Give your career a boost - join Toastmasters today! Stay ahead of the pack!


WHAT IS 730 TOASTMASTER CLUB? 

We are a local New York Toastmasters Club - part of the broader Toastmasters clubs family. We operate under the same high Toastmasters International standards and deliver a great, fun, save environment to practice your public speaking. We meet at TIAA-CREF location on 730 Third Avenue in New York - a short walk from Grand Central. We meet two times a month on the 1st and 3rd Thursday from 12:00-1:00 and an optional happy hour on the 3rd Thursday from 5:30-6:30 at a nearby location.  

You can test-drive the experience as a guest at first and determine if is something you want to commit to by joining the Toastmasters as an official member. 

The events currently on the calendar will be posted in the community. Please sign-up for those you can make it so we can plan for the space and track attendance. 

For more information please email: Toastmasters_NY@tiaa-cref.org .

Visit our Facebook group as well:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/730toastmasters/


WANT MORE INFO? KEEP READING

What is Toastmasters?

No, we don't make toasters!

From a humble beginning in 1924 at the YMCA in Santa Ana, California, Toastmasters International has grown to become a world leader in helping people become more competent and comfortable in front of an audience. The nonprofit organization now has nearly 270,000 members in more than 13,000 clubs in 110 countries, offering a proven – and enjoyable! – way to practice and hone communication and leadership skills.

Most Toastmasters meetings are comprised of approximately 20 people who meet weekly for an hour or two. Participants practice and learn skills by filling a meeting role, ranging from giving a prepared speech or an impromptu one to serving as timer, evaluator or grammarian.

There is no instructor; instead, each speech and meeting is critiqued by a member in a positive manner, focusing on what was done right and what could be improved.

Why Join?

Survey after survey shows that presentation skills are crucial to success in the workplace. Many people pay high fees for seminars to gain the skill and confidence necessary to face an audience. Toastmasters’ provides an option that is less expensive and held in high regard in business circles. This organization has been around for more than 84 years and offers a proven – and enjoyable – way to practice and hone communication and leadership skills.

You will…

·  Learn to communicate more effectively 

·  Become a better listener. 

·  Improve your presentation skills 

·  Increase your leadership potential 

·  Become more successful in your career 

·  Build your ability to motivate and persuade 

·  Reach your professional and personal goals 

·  Increase your self confidence.

How you do it.

·  Build speaking and leadership skills with time-tested methods 

·  Focus on areas of interest in our self-paced curriculum 

·  Receive suggestions for improvement through constructive evaluations

Toastmasters programs are . . .

·  Inexpensive 

·  Interactive 

·  Convenient 

·  Friendly 

·  Supportive

More than four million people have discovered the benefits of this proven learning formula. What are you waiting for?

Become a Member

Email:  Toastmasters_NY@tiaa-cref.org

·  Each group has a different personality – you may wish to visit more than one.  Go to http://www.toastmasters.org/ and use the “Find a Club tool” to find meetings near you.  Call or e-mail in advance (if possible) to confirm meeting time and location.

Ready for the next step?

·  After you attend a meeting, you can apply for membership (minimum age 18.)

·  At the meeting, ask for a membership application.

·  Membership is affordable, and if you are an employee of TIAA-CREF, the dues are covered through your total benefits package.

·  $20 new member fee (one time fee)

·  Toastmaster International half-year membership dues are $36 plus a one-time $20 fee for your new member kit. 

·  The VP Membership will send your application and fees to Toastmasters’ World Headquarters.

·  Your New Member Kit should arrive in the mail in about 10 days.

Toastmaster's Promise

As a member of Toastmasters International and my club, I promise...

·  To attend club meetings regularly

·  To prepare all of my speech and leadership projects to the best of my ability, basing them on projects in the Competent Communication, Advanced Communication or Competent Leadership manuals

·  To prepare for and fulfill meeting assignments

·  To provide fellow members with helpful, constructive evaluations

·  To help the club maintain the positive, friendly environment necessary for all members to learn and grow

·  To serve my club as an officer when called upon to do so

·  To treat my fellow club members and our guests with respect and courtesy

·  To bring guests to club meetings so they can see the benefits Toastmasters membership offers

·  To adhere to the guidelines and rules for all Toastmasters educational and recognition programs

·  To maintain honest and highly ethical standards during the conduct of all Toastmasters activities
results.name: 730 Toastmasters Club

results.description: The Little Garden is a beginners study group of A Course In Miracles dedicated to recognizing our relationship with god through one another. Our format is structured to introduce and apply the principles and methods of A Course In Miracles in our daily lives. To uncover the principles, we study portions of the text. To apply them, we practice workbook lessons. Each week, we meditate using a workbook lesson, and then study a principle or a workbook lesson, alternating between text and lessons. We also invite students to speak on their experience with a lesson or principle, focusing on a Miracle or Miracles they have experienced. results.description:
A crisis continues today in both the New York Courts as well as in the legal services provider community! Thousands of Civil and Supreme Court litigants continue to be unable to find or afford counsel and must appear pro se, without the competency to represent themselves. Moreover, the pro bono legal services provider community is unable to handle the enormous volume of litigants seeking representation. That this shortage of staffing is occurring at the same time that thousands of lawyers are unemployed deserves attention and a solution. Therefore, in order to help address the above structural representation and employment challenges,

917Lawyers Is creating and furthering a community of legal professionals for the purpose of organizing networking meet-ups to enabler participants to discover new public service, pro bono, and career opportunities. At these professionals’ only meet-ups, members will benefit from face to face networking with peers, expanding law firms and legal services providers, and gain knowledge and insight into future
employment as well as pro bono opportunities.

917Lawyers welcomes your thoughts and suggestions by email, and wishes success to all!

results.description:
Back in 1996, we were excited when we could only find a product in a web store, put it into the cart and have it delivered to our doorsteps. A few years forward, customer reviews and social sharing features made shopping already a lot more fun. Entering the Web 3.0 era, commerce is increasingly melting with content, community and context to create never seen before personal shopping experiences.

With the help of new technology, merchants and brands can analyze their customers’ characteristics and behaviours to engage with them within the context of their needs, desires, preferences, timing and location, to surprise and delight them and build long-lasting customer relationships.

The upcoming ecomhack New York is all about how smartphones, wearables, beacons and other emerging devices enable creating these personal experiences that make shopping more individual, more efficient – and more fun.

results.description:
Welcome to the Manhattan International Netball Club, and to playing netball in New York! The Club was established in 2000 by women with a love of netball and a desire to build a network for others who also enjoy the game. The Club membership has grown ten-fold since it was formed and continues to grow rapidly, made up predominantly of fun-loving professional women from overseas – with an emphasis on the fun!

MINC caters to competitive and social players. The Club runs weekly practices in Manhattan and regularly fields three teams at local or national tournaments. The aim of the Club is to allow those who participate at a high level achieve their full potential, while also recognizing that the Club provides a strong social network for its members. It balances these aims by having committees focused on coaching and development, as well as committees focused upon social events.

We welcome players of all abilities at all times of the year, so what are you waiting for? Contact our membership secretary, Sue, and come and try it out!

results.description:
Hey, nonprofit & startup professionals! Let's face it, looks matter. Whether you're in search of a prospective donor or client, you need to follow best design practices to be both noticed and understood. We're founded on the simple philosophy that design needs to be considered now so you'll have a more consistent brand later. But, we get that it might not make sense to take on a huge branding project before you have the funds or knowledge of your brand to back it up. That's where we come in.

We'll give you industry-tailored tools to follow simple design practices now at a rate you can afford. (We can tackle the big branding stuff later.) It's time for smart design to meet smart business.

It's our hope that in addition to connecting you with our classes, this meetup can serve as a discussion about local resources and tools, from printers and design tools to foundation funding and incubators.
results.name: Spark: Design Education for Startups & Nonprofits

results.description:
If you're a woman career professional, a mom transitioning back into the workforce or a mom who needs support to balance work and life, a woman entrepreneur who's juggling just about all she can juggle... or a woman who simply wants to experience support and empowerment through coaching, join the NY/NJ Echoes Coaching Circle Meetup!

EchoesTM Coaching Circles are Directed by the group and the Facilitator in a way that is helpful to each individual. Each circle is:

• A space for learning about yourself within the context of a group and/or a team
• A space to gather relevant information about your own approach to different situations by receiving feedback from circle members
• A space to tackle hard decisions, challenging situations, and gain varying perspectives from others 
• A space to be encouraged to take steps in scary situations
• A space to obtain tools on how to communicate better through role playing and other activities 
• A space to learn techniques to transfer into your life across the spheres
• A space to decompose and recompose the emotionality behind your approach to different situations and to understand how to manage this emotionality and use it to your advantage
• A space to develop a keen understanding about boundaries and the relevance of saying “No” or “Yes”
• A space to fine-tune verbal and gestural expression, and to become comfortable with being a consummate communicator
results.name: NY/NJ Echoes Coaching Circle Meetup

results.description:
This is a social meetup group for people who enjoy and share an interest in learning about knives and the culture that surrounds knives, swords and blades from all over the world.

Knives have been a part of all mankind. Today, they are featured in stories, in movies, used for productive things like camping, utility, collecting and even martial arts.

This group will feature regular get togethers to "show and tell", to discuss different topics related to knives, talk about scenes found in different movies related to blade use, martial arts training/use if people want to discuss those topics as well.

People who want to stop in can expect refreshments, snacks, perhaps some video clips and just a chill, relaxed hour or so, of discussion, education, fun and sharing of information/experiences. This is open to everyone over 21 years old and you don't have to be a martial artist, or an athlete or a would be tough guy, it's for anyone who has an interest in the topic of knives. Come and join us!
results.name: Blade Culture NYC

results.description:
Are you tired of living paycheck to paycheck?
Could you use more money to help pay for the things you need and want in your life?
Do you think you have the potential to make more money?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then you belong in our group. We have been working with seasoned professionals who have figured out how to make more money and want to give back to the community. Join us to tap into this knowledge and make a better life for you and your family.

One of the most important rules we have learned about making money is to share the knowledge with others to help THEM make money. The fastest way to make money is to help others make money.  We also strongly believe in the practice of tithing.  If you are helping others while making money it is not only very rewarding, but it inspires you to make MORE money to help MORE people.

There are SO many ways to make money and this is the place we will share them with you.  There is plenty of money to be made in this world.  There is no need to take advantage of others or do anything illegal.  In our group, we learn to live life abundantly because ABUNDANCE is our mindset.

There are several development tools that can create apps using visual layout of the interface, and easier to understand syntax to do the coding. If you ever go to Meetups because you have an idea for an app, but you find yourself being completely confused by the technicalities of the presentation, you should come to this Meetup instead!

Welcome the Tennis Social group for Asian and Asian Americans. If you are not of Asian descent please consider joining the many other tennis groups in the area.

Whether you are an absolute beginner to advanced player we welcome all levels of tennis enthusiasts, so long as you are willing to put the sweat and effort into improving your game and helping others improve theirs.

It is often hard to find a steady "hitting" partner which radically improves your game and gives motivation and encouragement to pound the pavement on a consistent basis. You should own your own racket and bring balls. When an event is organized please honor your RSVPs. We will find free courts to play in NJ or NY during the warm seasons, and seek in-door opportunities during the colder months.

results.description:
Hi everyone! I have been living in Astoria since 2012, and love it! And while I have many friends who live in other parts of the city, I'd love to meet more people within the immediate area.  I imagine there are many other Astorians out there who feel the same way.  As they say... 'Why Leave Astoria?'  ;-)

Most outings will occur within the confines of Astoria, and they will be 'eclectic'. (Only occasionally will I suggest an event outside of Astoria...)  Another feature of this group is that events will be limited to 10 or so people at a time. I want people to truly get to know each other...to have good conversation...I don't want this to feel like a networking/pickup-y/name-tag kind of group. 

Our group (whose  events will be purposefully small in size) is not like other Meetup groups where you can feel anonymous.  Not showing up for events of this size does affect the host and other attendees.  I understand that things happen.  All I ask is that if you can no longer attend, or have a strong sense you will be held up at work or with family issues, that you give me Two Hours notice.  Anyone who simply does not show up or give me sufficient notice that they can no longer make the event (or else who doesn't provide a damn good explanation and profuse apology after the fact ....lol), will have to be removed from the group..  I don't do this to be a taskmaster or anything...it's just very disheartening for me to pay Meetup Organizer dues,  arrange events, provide very detailed information on events to the group, and then for me to arrive at the venue, only to find a bunch of no-shows.  All I ask is for common courtesy.  If you're not prepared to give me that, that you shouldn't join this group.  ;-)  Thank you for your understanding!

Every so often I will arrange for a somewhat larger outing, once I feel that enough good relationships have been created between members of the group.

'YES' to:

- members that are engaging, who have a positive energy, with varied interests, and who are comfortable meeting new people and diving right into conversation!

- members who understand our events will generally be small and intimate, and that communicating to the host if you can no longer attend, is expected.   

- events where we support and enjoy both the new AND the old-school establishments of Astoria. (I think it's hugely important to support the small businesses that have been in Astoria for more than a few years, and which seem to be gradually disappearing due to rent increases, etc,)

'NO to:

- joining this group with the sole purpose of hoping to fill that romantic void in your life.  (I prefer members who already consider their lives full and engaging versus people who come to events, scope out the attendees, decide there's no one that 'interests' them, and then they disengage from the group.)  There are plenty of other 'singles' Meetup groups if that's your area of focus.

- joining this group because you see all Meetup members as potential clients for your business, product, etc.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

I find groups most interesting when they have a good mix of members (singles/couples, straight/gay, younger/older, etc.,) so no one should think this group might not be for them!  I'd like to have members who've already figured out that you can be good friends with people who have different backgrounds from you, different political views, economic backgrounds, much older/younger than you, etc.  What matters most is that we all are people with positive energy, and respect each others' viewpoints.  

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

NOTE:  To help offset the fees that I must pay to Meetup.com each month as a Group Organizer, I'd like to kindly ask for a $2 donation from each member, whenever they attend one of our events.  Thank you!

Thanks for your interest, and hope to see you soon!
results.name: Eclectic Astorians

results.description:
Africa is in the midst of a long boom and on fast-track to becoming the next economic frontier. Techies of the African Diaspora is a group formed to build a platform that connects savvy IT professionals to engage in meaningful discussions, create partnerships, network, and exchange innovative ideas. 

Our objective is to provide a co-learning environment where specific IT related questions can be asked and proper responses are presented. We aim to guide and mentor aspiring ICT professionals. Furthermore, we intend to: 

- foster collaboration between ICT professionals living on the African continent and those in the diaspora

 - organize Tech Meet-Ups

- have hackathons and code retreats 

- attract underrepresented groups (minority and/or women in low-income communities)

-  advocate for public and private sectors in devising impactful ICT investment plans

The group is open to anyone interested in sharing knowledge and learning more about technology and how it impacts the African Diaspora.
results.name: Techies of the African Diaspora

results.description: KRAV MAGA is a Self Defense system developed for the military in Israel that consist of a wide combination of practical techniques and realistic training scenarios. Ideas in Krav Maga include: Counterattacking as soon as possible (or attacking pre-emptively). Targeting attacks to the body's most vulnerable points. Maximum effectiveness and efficiency in order to neutralize the opponent as quickly as possible. Maintaining awareness of surroundings while dealing with the threat. Learning to understand the psychology of a street confrontation, and identifying potential threats before an attack occurs This meetup group is for anyone who would like to learn Krav Maga. We can get together to learn Self Defense against any real world dangers and counter in the quickest and most efficient way. The intensity of these workouts will keep you physically fit, develop awareness and build confidence over time. I have asked a friend, David Ordini to show us some of the basics of Krav Maga. We can meetup once a week and learn self defense from a 9 year Krav Maga student who studied under the grand master. So come and join us at our next meetup, learn self defense, meet some new people and have fun.
results.name: Krav Maga of New York

results.description:
This is a group for those who like Blues, Country & Gospel Music. "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!" are a unique entity in the NY/NJ music scene. They consider themselves the only guitar/vocal duo that mixes equal parts Rockabilly, Country and genuine guitar Gospel music with a spoonful of greasy Blues to wash it all down. Their influences include many seminal figures in American music, such as Hank Williams, Elvis Presley, Chuck Berry, Gene Vincent, Reverend Charlie Jackson, Howlin' Wolf, Wilbert Harrison, Arthur “Big Boy” Crudup, Sister Rosetta Tharpe, Brother Joe May, Charlie Feathers, Carl Perkins, Smiley Lewis, Brother Claude Ely and Lloyd Price, among many others. Watch them bring this amazing music alive at many great New York and New Jersey clubs and venues, and meet other like-minded fans of American Roots Music. This is not your father’s blues – it’s more like your grandfather’s…if your grandfather was a preacher in a Mississippi Baptist church.

What others are saying about "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!":

"When you hit the stage, it was like we were hit with a bolt of lightning! Truly electrifying! Really brought the place to life! You guys owned the stage like few have at The Way Station." - James Coyle

"These guys are amazing. The closest thing to Hank Williams Sr. this side of Heaven." - Jim Chum

"Together Gary Van Miert and Malcolm Marsden form the Sensational Country Blues Wonders, one of the best throwback blues groups on any side of the Hudson -- and quite likely good enough to swell with the Mississippi." - The Jersey Journal

"These guys are the real musical anarchists." - David Huberman

“They call it Country/Blues/Gospel, I call it.... I don't even know. If the lovechild of Carl Perkins and Hank Williams became a preacher whose church had a liquor store and an opium den, you might come close to The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!” - Valdaniel Martins

We got there and the country group “The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!” started their set. To be completely honest, country has never really been my favorite genre, but these guys TOTALLY changed my mind on country music. I absolutely loved them!! - CHICpeaJC
results.name: "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!"  Meetup Group

topics.name: Families of Children who have ADD/ADHD
parents of children with special needs

results.description: You're invited to join a group for parents with children whose behavior and learning problems suggest the possibility of Attention Deficit Disorder and/or Dyslexia. Many doctors, educators and parents express growing concern at the increasing number of young people being put on powerful medication for Attention Deficit Disorder, a condition often identified only by vague symptoms. A disproportionate number of young people are labeled and treated for A.D.D. in the U.S. compared to most other countries. This fact alarms many authorities, including law enforcement officials who now report high levels of abuse of A.D.D. and A.D.H.D.-related, prescribed drugs. Join us if your child: 1) Works slow, 2) Avoids reading, 3) Skips over words, 4) Reverses letters, or 5) Has poor reading comprehension.
results.name: ADHD/Dyslexia Parent Group NYC

results.description: “To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders (Lao Tzu).” Come join in a 45 minute session in the lovely environs of Prospect Park. Ten minutes will be upfront information on getting comfortable and the science around stress and meditation and then 30 minutes of guided meditation using the anchors of breath, sound and mantra. It's a great introduction for people who are interested but never felt inspired to start a meditation practice. It does a body and a mind a whole lot of good!  $5 donation, please. Thanks!
results.name: Guided Meditation in Prospect Park!

results.description: I recently lost my mother very suddenly, and have been surprised at how even NYC doesn't offer a support group for young adults who have lost a parent. While there are plenty of groups for kids and teens, older adults and even parentless parents, the "young adult" age range has been highly overlooked by bereavement support groups. Meanwhile, I have found it hard to relate to both people who lost parents in their teens or middle age; on the one hand, I had an adult relationship with my mother, but I also feel she will never get to see me finish "growing up" completely. On top of that, young adults are often living the most transitional, independent portions of their lives. Most of us here in NYC live away from family and our oldest friends, we are building careers, still figuring out who we are, experiencing the dizzying ups and downs of dating, and living in impermanent homes either alone or with strangers. My goal is to create a group who knows what it's like to be amidst the chaotic flows of young adult life while grieving the loss of a parent. This group is not so much based on age as it is what stage of life you feel you are in. If the above resonates with you, you are more than welcome to join. It does not matter how you lost your parent, or even if you are simply coping with a sick parent whom is still alive. Meetings will be casual, simple, fun, and relaxing -- a picnic at the park, a cool little restaurant, a warm bar, etc., and I strongly encourage all members to make suggestions. I just want to meet some new friends who are also figuring out how to live a good life under the heavy weight of grief, to hang out and heal in good company.
results.name: Young Adults Who Have Lost a Parent

This is a social network for professional lesbians in the tri-state age range is 40 plus.  It's about creating a like minded community of friendship and support.

This network is for all of us.  It doesn't matter whether or not we have lovers or partners but how full our lives  will be with a REAL, GENUINE, DEPENDABLE social circle available to us.

Come join me in this journey and let's make Qgirls connections the destination for all professional women who are in search of new friendships and support. 

I look forward to meeting you.

Cheers, Heather

results.description:
Welcome to NYC Beach Bums! 

Our meetup group is dedicated to get all the beach loving people of NYC to our events at Rockaway Beach and other NYC beaches this summer and start of fall. 

If you love to just chill on the beach with your friends, or if your a novice or an experienced boarder looking for a cool way to meet new people and have a great time then this club is for you.  

We offer a summer, & fall season club membership which includes regularly scheduled events to Rockaway Beach, and when the swells arrive we'll be posting events at Gilgo Beach and Ditch Plains! Later in the fall we'll be announcing some overnight trips to camp out and go surfing in Montauk right on the beach! 

The club has it's own 14 passenger van for transporting our members to our events and is outfitted with a custom roof rack to carry any type of gear to our events so bring your boards, coolers, couches, koozies... and whatever else you need!

We have a love for the Rockaway's and have been surfing there for over 20 years. It would be our pleasure to be your Rockaway sherpa and put you on to all the cool destination beaches there and the local hot spots to grab some of the best food, adult beverages, and parties in NYC right by the beach. 

Once the surf season is over we also run a meetup called NYC Go Wild Outdoor Club which runs from October - April and will be hosting trips up to some of the coolest parts of the Catskills and go to hidden swim holes, hiking, tubing, kayaking, camping, fishing, and throwing down some kick ass bbq's in the middle of nature. 

This is a real deal club and we're looking for a solid crew of members to have an awesome time with!

Looking forward to meeting you all!

Mahalo from your friends at NYC Beach Bums

Call us with any questions you may have 1.347.931.1600

results.description:
This is Daniel Jordano, actor and author of the humbly titled: "The Best Book on Acting: How to Become a Better Actor Instantly Without Killing Yourself with the Method"

If you are an actor, you've probably done your fair share of pointless exercises in classes: "Hold the imaginary teacup. Feel the warmth of the tea. Can you smell it? Can you smell it?" ...or you may have had your fill of "gurus" who may direct scenes, but don't give actors any understanding of how to get where they need to get--on their own!

Well we are launching a NEW workshop on Sept. 24th called “The Life Acting Workshop” where we don't have any gurus. We focus on each member putting up work in an atmosphere of helping one another using a simple and effective system called …LIFE ACTING...with an emphasis on ON CAMERA work.

Life Acting is summed up in the question: “What does your character want from the other actors/characters and how are you going to get it? At the current time, we are limited to 10 committed actors. The experience level is not the key issue here, but the willingness to make a commitment to the work.

Each workshop is only $25. Cash, Check made out to Veritas Arts International, or paypal: veritasartsinc@gmail.com

The initial one will take place from 7pm to 10pm on Thursday, September 24th My goal for this is to develop an encouraging and safe place to work and improve our craft as actors. I am serving as the facilitator. Not a guru. We will learn and be encouraged by ONE ANOTHER!
results.name: The Life Acting Workshop

results.description:
Write, Speak, and Teach is a meetup to create momentum for its members to create and ship great content.

If you are a writer, speaker, or teacher (or an author, podcaster, coach, or trainer) you need to get the word out about your work. Content marketing is the best way to get the word out and build your platform.

Content marketing means creating great content, in multiple formats, and then engaging with others about the content, in ways that creates more content, which builds your brand and visibility. 

In the process of creating content, your best effort and a deadline should be the goal, not perfection. 

Lets come together as a group in fun interactive ways, to learn, to take on the challenge of disciplined content creation, and to create momentum for ourselves and each other. 

This group requests member dues because we meet in NYC at a cool interactive space, which costs decent money.

Our first meetup will be a "Launch Some Work" challenge to get the ball rolling.

"Create and ship... create and ship..."

results.description: We are a social group for LGBTQ Single Parents. Whether you are single by choice, divorce, or widowhood, this is a place for us to get together, socialize, share resources, and be proud of who we are. Whether you are a parent through biology, adoption, Donor Egg/Sperm, Surrogacy or Fostering, let's connect! Maybe you have been out since you were 12. Maybe you are just coming out. Either way, you are all included. Maybe you are just thinking of becoming a single LGBT parent, or perhaps you are already in the midst of trying and need encouragement and advice. All are welcome. All gender identities and queer sexual orientations are included. We meet in kid friendly spaces so we don't have to get babysitters. We go to the Gay Center Family Play Day together so we are not the only single parents there. We meet for a picnic in the park, or even sometimes go out for a night on the town. Let's unite! Get to know each other! Share struggles and celebrate our triumphs! We are amazing and we should all know each other!

We'll invite featured guests with newly launched or nearly launched tech products and services to give us a hands-on demo. Let's play with new tech. Let's play games. Let's mess with a SaaS. results.description:
The Brooklyn HubSpot User Group (HUG) is a community of Inbound marketing professionals and business owners. Some of us have been using HubSpot for years, some of us run marketing agencies, and some are just starting to learn about Inbound. If you love networking and exploring new ways to grow your business, join us for a meetup!

Do I have to be a HubSpot User?

Nope! In addition to current users, we welcome anyone interested in learning more about HubSpot or Inbound Marketing in general. That said, our agenda will typically include a deep-dive into some aspect of the HubSpot tools, or a customer case study.

Is this Going to be a Sales Pitch?

No! The sole purpose of a HUG is to get together and learn the best of HubSpot from one another. A basic tenet of Inbound Marketing is understanding that people hate being sold to. We earn trust through education.

What's a Typical HUG Agenda Like?

All HubSpot user groups follow a similar agenda, which includes networking, an educational presentation, and a group discussion. At least twice each year we'll also have guest speakers from HubSpot headquarters join us! Our meetups are casual, helpful, and provide members with complimentary food, drinks and HubSpot SWAG.

What Should I Bring to the Meet-Up?

Business cards for networking, something to take notes (Wifi will be available, if you want to bring a laptop or tablet), and an open mind for learning and sharing.

Can My Company Host a Meet-Up?

Absolutely! One of the more challenging aspects of meetup planning is finding space, so if your company can accommodate a group of 30+, let's chat. We require a location our members can get to easily via major subway lines, high-speed Wifi, a large presentation monitor (or a large screen and laptop projector), enough space for networking, and the ability to bring in food and drinks. In exchange for your hospitality, we'll include your logo and link to your site on our registration landing page, as well as social media promotion. Email bklynhug@gmail.com to start a conversation!
results.name: Brooklyn HubSpot User Group

topics.name: Meeting old friends and making new friends

results.description:
After a crazy hectic day or week at work, come join the NYC/NJ Indian Hobnobbing! This group is a social mixer for making new friends or meeting old friends, dating, and professional networking. Let's grab our favorite drink in a nice relaxing ambience and mingle with our Indian friends. I work for a luxury fashion house in NYC and have driven fun PR events. Despite living in and around such a populated city brimming with Indians, it is still so hard for us to find like minded people and continuing to be in touch. Here’s your opportunity-JOIN TODAY!! Let the conversations begin.....

This is a member approved group only!

results.description:
We are planning to take part in the "Democracy Spring" which is a citizen lead mass gathering in Washington DC planned for early April of this year. (www.democracyspring.org). The focus is on getting big money out of politics and overturning Citizens United. Many will be marching from the Liberty Bell in Philadelphia to our nation's capital. Others will bike from NYC to DC, traveling 264 miles in 5 days (www.ride4therepublic.org). This will be an historic event. Thousands have committed to take part in peaceful civil disobedience. We hope you will join the NY Rebellion contingent at the Democracy Spring.

The NYRebellion is following in the footsteps of "Granny D" - Doris Haddock, who walked across the entire country at age 88 to bring attention to the country's need for campaign finance reform. We have adopted the community organizing strategy started by the NHRebellion where citizens have been walking across the state of New Hampshire to build public awareness. We want to help spread this movement to other states. 

The NY Rebellion is a project of the Phoenix Factory, a non-profit focused on campaign finance reform and women's leadership. We are bi-partisan and welcome all who are committed to the restoration of democracy in America.
results.name: NY Rebellion

results.description: We are a group of highly motivated entrepreneurs looking to ensure the state of New Jersey is won by Donald Trump. Another one of our goals is to Eradicate Hunger in our city of Bayonne and facilitate Financial Independence for all. www.NewJerseyForTrump.com

results.description: The NJ Urban Professionals Social group is for Black, Latino, and Asian professionals in their 20s and 30s living in the Northern and Central NJ area who want to get together after work or on weekends to just hang out and chill. We are educated and have multiple responsibilities but want to have fun, make new friends and just enjoy our free time together. We live in NJ so why do we have to go all the way to NYC to have fun? We can do it right here!!!! Our meetups will include: after-work happy hours, local events, game nights, movie nights, day trips, BBQs, beach outings, whatever people want to do. We will foster a fun, chill, laid-back and welcoming, drama-free environment where we can all have a great time. Membership is free but you must be an educated professional to join. Be respectful of one another at meetups, any inappropriate behavior will be cause for you to be removed from the group. We want this group to be active, so feel free to suggest meetup events. If you're interested in going, someone else will be to. So don't be afraid to speak up. WELCOME and we can't wait to meet you.

results.description: A MEETUP FOR STUDENTS TO JOIN TOGETHER AND START THEIR OWN STARTUPS The Problem Often the hardest part of starting a startup is getting things off the ground. Finding a team, and building the initial structure to gain the interest of serious seed investors can be tough. The Solution What if there was a simple way for you to meet fellow students with complimentary skill sets and team up with them to build your startup together? Introducing Starting Startups a meetup for students to create their own jobs by building their own companies together.

results.description:
Have you given up on your dreams? Are you stuck or feel like it's too late to be that greater person that you know is inside? 

Well, this group is for individuals who are interested in personal/professional development and growth. The intention is for like-minded people to come together to create accountability and support; to share information and best practices. No one rises to the top by themselves. Each of us need supporters, mentors, and cheerleaders who encouragingly support our vision and goals .

We are seeking those who struggle with procrastination; who lack clarity of vision; or need that encouraging word of accountability that motivates us to keep on keepin on and Get It Done!

Our structure is based on the personal success books/models of masterminds like John Maxwell, Napoleon Hill, etc.  We will incorporate the tools and techniques prescribed in their modules to guide, enlighten and direct us to right thinking and commitment to personal action. 

This group is for: individuals who desire to build and grow their potential;  people who are looking for a support team to engage in helping, stretching, giving and receiving to one another of one's talents, gifts and purpose.

"You can have everything in life that you want if you will just help enough other people get what they want" -- Zig Ziglar

Stop trying to grow it alone. Decide this day to Get It Done!
results.name: Get It Done! Personal Growth Meetup

We will plan kid friendly outings such as beach days, bowling, museum trips, picnics, etc. We are open to all parents that identify as polyamorous, poly-curious, open, etc.

Please note: If you do not have a clear picture of yourself you will not be accepted into the group. If you do not include information about your children you will not be accepted into the group. Our Group Philosophy: Our children are growing up in a brave new world and we want to give them the best tools to handle their changing environment and succeed. If there is anything you would like to offer or request feel free to reach out. results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in learning to  metaphysics, expanding your energy, experiencing soul growth, expanding your psychic powers and working with spirit. The focus of this group is positive development of your spiritual path by learning and practicing Psychic and EVIDENTIAL Mediumship. 

This group is for anyone who is interested in learning and developing Psychic abilities through Tarot cards, Angels cards, Spirit drawings and Evidential Mediumship (EM). EM is bringing messages from love one in spirit. Developing your senses such as the 5 Clairs-Clairaudience, Clairsentience, Clairvoyance,Clairalience & Clairgustance  and will help you give unique evidence that will have everyone truly know that spirit is with them.

As the group facilitator and the founder of Supreme Soul Healing and Learning Center, Dolores Rilho is a Professional Psychic Medium. She has studied with the finest psychic mediums, as well as studied at the famous Arthur Finlay Psychic College in England, Journey Within, Montclair Metaphysical Center. Supreme Soul Healing and Learning Center has an extensive menu of Spiritual development class in South Jersey. 

About the Group: The group meet-ups meet weekly. Each meet-ups will last approximately two hours.7:00pm—9pm. The meet ups will consist of meditations, discussions on various topics related to intuition and psychic abilities and sharing our own experiences. Each session will include group exercises to help us explore and validate our abilities and to develop further. 

A few of the topic we’ll be discussing are Spirit Communications, Inspirational Writing, meditation, message circles, and a lot more. You must be over 18. If you are under the age of 18, please call to discuss your development and ability to sit. $20.00 per meet-up unless noted otherwise How to Join: If you are interested in joining the group please send a request and a little information about yourself. results.description:
New York and New Jersey’s businesses and non-profits as well as educational and governmental institutions all face the same dilemma. Human resource departments throughout the region are unable to fill hundreds of vacancies for highly qualified bilingual and technical professionals. Yet the fact that this shortage of staffing is occurring at the same time that thousands of experienced bilingual and technical candidates are unemployed, deserves attention.

To help address said employment challenges, the New York & New Jersey Bilingual and Tech Career Network Is creating this community of professionals with bilingual capabilities and/ or or tech experience/training.

The New York & New Jersey Bilingual and Tech Career Network will organize networking meetups to enable members to discover new career opportunities, and on occasion obtain useful professional development too! Members will benefit from face to face networking with peers, expanding local businesses, non-profits and government institutions to gain knowledge and insight into future employment as well career training opportunities. 

 The New York & New Jersey Bilingual and Tech Career Network welcomes your thoughts, suggestions, and recommendations as well as sponsorship inquires and wishes success to all!
results.name: New York & New Jersey Bilingual and Tech Career Network

The group is about: learning  ways to create a positive mindset, healthy living, and spiritual growth. Our ideal members are people who are into personal and spiritual development and want to adopt a healthy lifestyle. People should join us to learn, share, grow , and have fun.  A typical activity would be attending a workshop, going out for a meal, going to a movie, journaling about an experience, making a DYI product, and more.   Let's get together and experience different activities that promote wellbeing and add value to our lives. We will have workshops and social activities that will enliven and inspire us. Looking for positive people to join the group who would like to experience activities to add balance to your life.

results.description: New York City isn't the easiest or friendliest place to fly RC airplanes. We don't have the luxury of wide open fields with no one around to bother. I am a member of a local aviation club, but it can take up an hour or longer each way to get there and it just isn't always practical. I like to fly small to larger airplanes as well. I've found that some respectful and cautious local flying in NYC can be possible if we really respect our surroundings and don't do stupid things. This meetup is only for RC Airplanes and unfortunately no Quadcopters or Drones. I own and enjoy some myself, but the reckless use of these had shed a negative light on the hobby and there are other groups for that. My aim is to gather some quiet, respectful and fun people to fly our planes as close to or in Manhattan without causing any issues and flying places which don't violate restrictions. I have a whole series of future events and plans that I am working on but this is a simple start.
results.name: New York Radio Control Airplanes Meetup

topics.name: Anything and everything you've ever wanted to do.
