results.description:
This is an experimental Meetup group for those of us who do things a bit more impromptu: we might wake up on a Saturday morning and decide to go rock climbing or hiking; or we thought we were going to have a mellow weekend but get a little restless. We text our friends but it's too last minute -- gosh darn those planners! This Meetup group is intended to bring us together and make those spontaneous adventures a little more social. 

We will organize monthly Meetups - happy hours, picnics, etc.: larger events where people in the group can get together and meet. For regular activities, we will use the Okk app (http://okk.co). It's better suited for bringing together small groups of people in a more impromptu fashion and allows groups to organize and chat without having to share your phone number or email. Post your activity using the #nycsp hashtag so members can more easily find them! 

Once we get our regular happy hours going, our hope is that we will be able to greatly extend each others’ social circles with more familiar faces and have a larger network to draw from when we decide to do something spur of the moment! Looking forward to meeting everyone!
results.name: New York City Spontaneous People (20s to 30s)

results.description:
Calling all novel nerds and literature ladies! Welcome to FICTION ADDICTION, an ensemble of young women (aged 20-35) who read, gather, and drink. Our fiction addiction is fed by a novel and a graphic novel each month. Meeting locations are chosen based on the theme of the book.

Each month we decide on a theme. Will it be murder, graphic novel memoirs, dystopian fiction, or fearless female leads? It's up to you to decide! Once chosen, the group is given 5 choices for that month's read. For those avid readers who need MORE to read, in between each monthly book club is a separate cultured comic club who reads a graphic novel. 

Perhaps the next Meetup will be held at a 1920s speakeasy, a Victorian parlor, a warm biergarten, or a back alley apothecary. It's up to you to decide! 

So pull a book off your shelf, crack that spine, pour yourself a glass of wine and start reading with us! 

"A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies." - George R.R. Martin 

-----

No Show Policy // Members will be removed from the group after 2 RSVP no-shows. We totally understand plans change and important commitments arise. To ensure you are not marked a no show, please leave a comment to the group, message me privately, or change your RSVP any time before the event. (Last minute cancellations accepted!)
results.name: Fiction Addiction: Women Hooked on Books

results.description:
The NYSA group meets for an extraordinary odyssey into a healing sound-scape for a deeper meditation, renewed inspiration and greater enlightenment fostering inner harmony and tuning in to the music of our own souls.

Hello, I AM Sunny Quetzacoatl. I AM native to the high desert of central Mexico, of Toltec ancestry, born in the land of the Chichimeca. I recently relocated to New York from Los Angeles, CA. and I look forward to contributing sound vibration therapy as a healing art modality. I offer to guide my fellow sound alchemists into a beautiful dream through which we will all reach a zero point state of being. My intention for NY Sound Alchemy is to create a comfortable, invigorating, magical, mysterious, and healing "sound-bath/sound-scape" for my guests. I will play several instruments to relax you and inspire you.

I seek to activate your 6 senses. I will offer organic vegan friendly cacao tea and oils to activate the senses accordingly. Very minor adjustments of shoulders before during or after to those who ask. Sage & Palo Santo may also be used.

My sonidos curanderos will help wash away all stress, worry and discomfort and the vibrations within our space will unlock your imagination. Together, through breath and sound, we will create a perfect sound-scape; a sonic, phonic arena for your spirit to travel to and through. I invite you to join me and my fellow NY Sonic Shamanic alchemists as we travel with the mind, body and spirit by being present w stillness and contributing a steady thorough breath.

Guy Douglas "The Gong Man", "DEEP Exhale"/LA and "Sonic Shamanic"/LIB-DoLab-SoCal. are my soundscape progenitors; and what I contribute is a nexus of deep rooted tribal vibrations and an oscillation of fluid, elastic, Cosmic pulsations. You will be raptured by the sounds of a Live Native American flute, Didgeridoo drone pipe, Ocean wave drum, Crystal & Tibetan singing bowls, rain monsoon tower, thunder-maker, serpent rattle, and a sometimes (as inspired) very special Sun language orison; a vernacular tongue which you may surprisingly recognize. Welcome to the New York Sound Alchemisty movement.
results.name: New York Sound Alchemy

The group lacks business-focus in favor of exploratory engineering-- a place to implement the objects of imagination. Create for fun and for friends. I formed this group because I'm tired of creating only those things that yield a paycheck. I want to implement the money-sink ideas that I've imprisoned to the "someday" room in my mind. The first of these ideas is an autonomous underwater vehicle with the purpose of exploring the waters around Manhattan. If you're interested in working on this, you should definitely join. No matter your skillset, there's a place for everyone. Heck, brew some beer and hang out if that's your forte.

results.description:
It's not a typo! Wallyball is a fun and exciting sport that has recently become more popular in the NYC area and even though it derives from volleyball, it has its own rules: It is played on a racquetball court, in teams of 3, but the reason it is so enjoyable is that players are allowed to play the ball off of the side walls' bounce.

For all of you, volleyball junkies, this is a great way to challenge your game. 

For those of you who are fairly new to volleyball, you can be sure that you will have a great time while you're working your butts off!

You have two options to choose from:

 1. Join a team and participate in the only official Wallyball League in New York City. 

2. Join as an individual member and come to our open plays every Monday and Wednesday night. 


For details, visit: http://www.nyvolleyballinstitute.com/

results.description:
Join us on Saturdays at 75 Jackson street Suite 2A Hoboken NJ 07030 for a fun filled class to learn classic boxing techniques with cross training fitness emphasis.

Class Fee $10 per person  for the 1 hour Boxing Session which will be collected as a $43.79/monthly  membership fee

If you want to play you must bring the gear of the pro's:

• Boxing gloves

• Hand wraps/ Wrap gloves

• Workout clothes / sneakers

• Towel 

• Bottle of water

• Optional equipment Boxing mitts and jump rope ( if you have them bring them-the more the merrier)

Boxing SGT (small group training) class break down:

• 5 - 10min park / workout area run

• Jump rope / plyometric warmup (burpees,  jump squats, ladder drills etc..)

• Focus mitts work ( boxers punching mitts technique drills )

• Boxing bag drills ( heavy bag , uppercut bag, double end bag and speed bag drills)

• Semi-contact ; you and your partner strike the pads using time tested boxing techniques (no this is not a cardio kickboxing dance class )

• 3 minutes rounds and 30 second active rest ( push-ups, squat jumps, running in place etc..)

• Partner drills (medicine ball , resistance bands , kettle-bells etc..)
results.name: Hoboken Boxers Bootcamp

results.description:
The Fort Lee Regional Chamber of Commerce Meetup Group provides business owners, entrepreneurs, and professional service providers a forum to share ideas, strategies, discuss problems, and explore opportunities that will help grow businesses and increase profits.

We meet monthly. Topics will include branding, social media, negotiating, presentation skills, marketing, workplace communication, financial controls, technology, cyber-security, hacking, and risk management. The Fort Lee business community is fortunate to have many experts in these fields. A meeting could include a guest presentation, a discussion panel or table set up for questions and answers with one of these people.

This Group is about the exchange of ideas with other liked-minded business professionals who want to advance their knowledge and awareness of what it takes to succeed in today's fast changing business environment. Looking to share your business experience? Looking to pick up some new ideas? That’s what we’re all about. 

This is not a networking group or a place to get leads. There is, however, an opportunity to make new connections.  This is not the place to make your sales pitch, although your sales method can be an interesting subject to discuss with other sales professionals. Sharing ideas openly with others on what works, and what doesn’t, can improve your game.

For over 65 years the Fort Lee Regional Chamber of Commerce has been promoting and supporting our business community. This is an exciting time for Fort Lee as we experience a renaissance of new business and residential growth. This Group is not limited to members of the Fort Lee Regional Chamber of Commerce. It’s open to all businesses and their employees.

We invite you to join us to share your ideas and experiences as well as your questions and concerns, and become part of Fort Lee’s exciting future.

 Thank you for your time,

 Respectfully,

 FORT LEE REGIONAL CHAMBER OF COMMERCE

topics.name: National Politics-What Direction Are We Headed In

results.description: We are a group that aims to create and collaborate on initiatives that will strengthen the lives of others. Disruption may be the buzzword these days, but we believe that our society is already disrupted and polarized to a dangerous degree. To that end, we want to bridge the gaps that may jeopardize the health and vitality of this and future generations. We will use new tools to fulfill time-tested objectives. To name but a few: - A reliable, non-partisan database for where political candidates stand. Beneath all the spin and style, what is the substance? - An app where state and local governments can hear of infrastructure-related complaints from drivers. Also a way for people to crowd-source funding for infrastructure projects like decaying bridges. - A system where needy school districts - such as those afflicted by natural disasters - can acquire the resources and support for quality extracurricular programs. For example, one of its efforts shall try to provide musical instruments to schoolchildren, that they may discover their creativity and our rich musical heritage. For these and other endeavors, we seek contributors of various types. From the entrepreneurs who can strengthen the intellectual and moral foundations, to the advisors who can provide technical support and expertise, to the coders who can bring these endeavors to life (and even teach the code neophytes a thing or two!) - we happily welcome you into this community. A community which strives to foster and strengthen our communities.

topics.name: Happiness, Happy, Law of Attraction, Whole Foods
Health and Support, Happiness, Wellbeing, Healing
What is Happiness: What Makes Us Happy

results.description:
About Happiness Clubs

A Happiness Club is a monthly forum with the sole mission of promoting the benefits and scientifically-proven theories of Happiness and Positive Psychology.  Meetings feature inspirational speakers who will introduce us to different happiness boosting techniques and ways we can increase our emotional and physical wellbeing. 

Happiness is an inner state of well-being that empowers an individual to be their best possible self, and we could all use a little more!

Positive Psychology is the scientific study of human flourishing, and an applied approach to optimal functioning. It has been defined as the study of the strengths and virtues that enable individuals, communities and organizations to thrive.  So, let's explore this together!

There are approximately 140 Happiness Clubs worldwide, including a number of them in Connecticut with long-standing histories within their communities.

For more information: http://happinessclub.com

About the Facilitator

Donna Vella is a healthy lifestyle and positivity advocate.  She is a 2012 graduate of the Institute for Integrative Nutrition and is a Certified Holistic Health Coach. She is currently studying Positive Psychology under Dr. Tal Ben-Shahar and is pursuing a second career as a Happiness Ambassador and Positive Psychology Coach. Donna is a volunteer for The Orthopaedic Foundation for Active Lifestyles, Slow Food USA/Fairfield County, former Team Captain – WalkTheWalk America, and was known as “Dr. Ima CrackUp, the Tender Heart Specialist” in Stamford Hospital’s Health and Humor Associates (HAHA) Caregiving Clown Program.

For the last 25 years, Donna has kept corporate CEOs and senior executives organized.  She is currently the office manager for a Stamford, CT. based commodities trading firm.  Donna was born and raised in upstate New York and is a graduate of the Rochester Institute of Technology.  She lives in Stamford with her husband, Mike.
results.name: Stamford Positive Living Forum

results.description:
Purpose of the Group

The purpose of this group is to provide all levels of spiritual seekers a practical and effective means of manifesting to higher levels of consciousness. Consciousness in this sense can be defined as the level of one's awareness of reality. Those who truly seek greater truths and are Willing to surrender preconceived notions, beliefs, ideas, opinions, and views are guaranteed an advancement in their own awareness. Those who say they are willing but still cling to various instilled beliefs and illusory fears due to past experiences, are not guaranteed the same outcome.

• Willingness = readiness, plus personal conviction to affect a change through trust in a higher power greater than oneself.

• Surrender = release, relinquish, or give up any beliefs, opinions, or ideas that one believes to be true about oneself, others, life and the world.


Intention of Meetings

The intention of each meeting is to provide spiritual principles that one may practice in life to attain higher levels of awareness/consciousness.­ The concordant practices and principles encompass a variety of teachings throughout human history that when adhered to can lead to the state known as enlightenment or bliss. In reality, all the teachings are essentially the same thing varying only in culture, location, time period, etc... Therefore, the agenda is to present the principles and facilitate an understanding of them and the means by which they can be used with the current life circumstances members would like to address.
results.name: Consciousness Transcended

results.description:
This all-girls group is aimed at professional career-oriented women aged 31-45 to meet for brunch, dinner, happy hours, movies, impromptu picnics in Manhattan and surrounding boroughs. I'm 38 so I decided to go up 7 years and down 7 years to ensure a good range of age for potential life-long friends. This group will encourage members to form new and lasting friendships with other like-minded career-oriented women in the similar age bracket of 31-45. 

With that said, I hope to have a meetup at least once a week for a total of 4-5 meetups each month (ranging from brunch, dinner, happy hour to dinner and a movie, Friday afternoon lunch, etc) for small intimate parties of 6-10. There is a $3 meetup fee that will be collected offline at the end of the meetup when the bill arrives. It will be used to offset the meetup organizational costs ($180 per year for running a group). Please bring enough cash to cover this. If you sign up for a meetup and fail to show up (2) times or cancel within 2 days of the meetup, you will be removed from this group and banned. No exceptions so only sign up if you are sure you can make the meetup.

A recognizable photo picture on your profile and answers to all my profile questions are required in order to be allowed into the group. I will cap group membership at 100-110 women, and keep active members only  in order to keep the group manageable. If you do not agree to the above rules and regulations, feel free not to join my group - there are thousands of other meetup groups so if my rules offput you, you are welcome to not join it and find another group more suited to your needs.

Hope to see you soon at a meetup!

results.description:
We believe that books have the ability to transform lives! 

Join us for lively discussions of books that inspire, motivate and help us live our best lives. We focus on self-help, personal development and spirituality books. 

Reading groups enhance the reading experience by creating a community of people who help you expand your consciousness. We started this group because we wanted to create a space where people who like to read soul-stirring books could come together to share our thoughts and experiences. It will also be a great place to meet new people and create new friendships. 

Some of the authors we’ll be reading who represent this genre are:

Joel Osteen ~ Wayne Dyer ~ Eckhart Tolle ~ Don Miguel Ruiz ~ Thich Nhat Hanh ~ Deepak Chopra ~ Pema Chodron ~ Gary Zukav ~ Ram Dass ~ Dalai Lama ~ Byron Katie ~ Marianne Williamson ~ Michael Bernard Beckwith ~ Harville Hendrix ~ and many others 

We meet in midtown Manhattan the 2nd Sunday of the month at 3 pm. 

Members are encouraged, but not required, to select and host a book at a monthly meeting. This responsibility will be rotated each month. As the discussion leader for the book you select, you're expected to provide 3-5 questions for the group to discuss. Discussion questions can be found at the end of the book , at the author's website , at the publisher's website , by Googling the title of the book , or by creating your own questions. Please check to see if the book you're hosting is available at the library for those who prefer to borrow rather than buy. The library websites are: nypl.org , bklynlibrary.org , queenslibrary.org 

Members are also expected to have read the book before the meeting so you can contribute to the discussion in a meaningful way. 

If you too believe that shared reading will enhance your reading experience, please consider joining us.
results.name: Live Your Best Life Book Club

results.description:
Meetup purpose

Sometimes we are not strong enough by ourselves to change our ways, or to kick bad habits. I started this group because I want people to be supporters of each other. Help each other change their ways, form new habits, and live a happier life. Support can then become like a life line that is used to keep yourself motivated. It's helpful to know you are not alone in what keeps you from changing your ways, and to hear other people's stories. Let's gather, let's talk about it, and most importantly let's Kick "it"(bad habits).


Who should join?

This is a group for all the people who are fed up with their bad habits, and finally want to kick them to the curve. Whether it's eating, exercising, communicating, thinking, speaking, smoking, or any bad habit , kick it! This includes those moments when you let people take advantage of you, or are very passive. If it's not making you a better person then it has to go.


Why should you join?

You should join if you like to join others in their fight to free themselves from the imprisonment of bad habits! You never know who you might help , or who might  help you.
results.name: Just Kicking it(Bad Habits) Meetup Group

results.description:
Have you ever thought about being a part of something supportive, motivational, encouraging, and feeds you spiritually? Have you ever thought about being a part of something that you can meet new friends and discuss different topics concerning life? Have you ever felt like just leaving significant other at home, and just letting your hair down to hang out with the girls? Are you tired of just hanging with kids all day and just want to be grown for one night without children? If you answered yes to any of these questions, put on that little black dress, pull and dust those heels out of the closet, let your hair down and come and hang out the D.W.W.A.C. We are Diva's With Wisdom and Class! This group was formed because there is a serious need for coming together as women. We want to uplift, share our hearts, dreams and desires and to have girls night out on the town. We want to grow together and learn who we are, whose we are and know our worth. We are a group for women of color primarily between the ages of mid 20's and above, we are interested in creating lasting friendships, meeting positive and intelligent women of color who are also trying to build new friendships through participating in a multitude of activities and most importantly by having fun. Every month you will have the opportunity to connect with POWERFUL, ENERGETIC, DYNAMIC, VIRTUOUS women that wants to build lasting relationships, collaborate, support, network, and share an amazing moment with YOU!

We consider ourselves DIVAS, not because of our looks, not because of our figures. We consider ourselves DIVAS because to us the meaning of a DIVA is someone who is strong, confident and feels very comfortable in her own skin. A DIVA is not only a dreamer, but a visionary, she sees what she wants and strives to achieve that very thing.

results.description:
One habit that a significant percentage of successful people have in common is engaging in some kind of meditative practice. From billionaire investors, to elite athletes, to Hollywood moguls, to dating gurus, to gun-slinging entrepreneurs, meditation comes up again and again as a practice they attribute much of their success to. And yet, many young professionals in today's fast-paced world are turned off by the practice of meditation due to the strong religious connotations with which it is taught. 

My goal in this meetup group to to lead guided sessions for the modern New Yorker.  We will take traditional meditation and related practices (Zen meditation, Transcendental Meditation, Yoga Nidra, Pranayam) and explore them in a rigorous, scientific way, while maintaining their ancient and everlasting qualities. 

Sessions will include survey courses that cover a range of different meditative practices to course that go deep into particular types of practice. Eventually, we will plan retreats (weekends or longer) to different beautiful parts of the US.
results.name: Meditation for the Modern New Yorker

results.description:
Join us and learn how our local community has acquired over 150 rental units in an 18 month period working as a TEAM.  We aren't a group of strangers passing around business cards, we are a family of local and, not so local investors that call, text, facebook, instagram, skype, periscope, and whatever else you can think of. We spend time getting to know each other on not just a professional level, but a personal one too. We all work toward each other's success by working together as a TEAM, a COMMUNITY, and a FAMILY.

Right Now the Real Estate market is hotter and more lucritive than ever!!! In an article in Brick Underground  Magazine Jonathan Miller of Miller Samuel says, "More brand new condos are hitting the market, increasing the supply of apartments overall, and interest rates are still "hovering at near-record lows,". So, if you plan on buying and holding for residual income, now is a good time to get your foot in the door.

Now is the time to get into Real Estate before these record low interests rate  increase, and you miss out on a great opportunity. 

Are you interested in becoming part of a rapidly growing community of successful local Real Estate investors, who are securing the benefits of a once in a life time Buyers market? 

Right here and now we are in a unique Real Estate buyers market which is fueling the rapid growth of our local community of investors. With the intermingling of record low mortgage rates and lowered housing prices, our group is slaying in this market. You can look it up, the "world's greatest Investor" Warren Buffet is advising people to invest in real estate. At our investors meetings we discuss not only why, but how there are more millionaires created through real estate than any other industry.

You will have the opportunity to:

*Discuss the biggest money making opportunities in today's market: Lease Options, Buy and Hold, Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Foreclosures and REOs, Short Sales, Multi-Family Dwellings, Commercial and far more.

*Learn how rental properties are one of the best tax redeemable strategies out there.

*Get locally mentored and coached by the best.

*LEARN how to go from an investor that is only making a little extra money and still working for someone else, to a SUCCESSFUL Real Estate Investor who isn't a slave to an alarm clock, and where you have the option to never work a 9-5 again. 

*Find out how you can EARN substantial income while you LEARN how to invest in Real Estate.

*Network with a local group of successful Real Estate Investors.

*Save money on your taxes.

*Pay off your debts faster with our group's mortgage acceleration class.

*And so much more. 

Each REI community meeting is distinctive as we show you different transactions we've accomplished recently. We will also show you how you can be included in deals. 

Some of our team invest part time while still working for someone else, while others have been able to FIRE THEIR BOSS and smash their alarm clocks to invest full time. If you are interested in learning how to do this and more, RSVP for the events. We have a nationwide network of Real Estate Investors in addition to our local team in the NY Metro Area that will show you how.

We provide the training and mentor-ship, all you need to do is believe in yourself, work hard and show up, not for us, but for you. Your life is a series of choices, so you are solely responsible for the life that you are currently living. If you want better, BE BETTER. If you want experience change, then CHANGE YOURSELF. YOU CAN DO IT! 

Let us help YOU.
results.name: NY/NJ Real Estate Investing for Financial Freedom

results.description:
This meetup group can be described with 2 words : Serendipity + Francophilia !

Francophilia : for those who have learned (years ago) or are learning French and want to practice and improve their conversation skills in a fun and enjoyable way with native French speakers. Also for Francophone people visiting New York, it can be a nice way to discover the city and speak French with Americans/locals!

Serendipity : During nice weather, we might do things outdoors like : going for a hike upstate (e.g.: Cold Springs, the Croton Aqueduct ; walking along the Bronx River, the NJ Palisades or along the Walt Whitman trail...) ; or exploring landmarks in the city or special places like the Chinatown of Flushing, or Coney/City Island. We could also just meet in a beautiful place like the Cloisters, Governor's Island, Lyndhurst's Rose Garden or Untermeyer Park for a picnic, enjoy a sunset in a dramatic landscape, or watch an outdoor movie. In winter or rainy weather we could visit a wing of the MET or explore the art in the metro, or even just meet for a drink in a speakeasy bar. Any activity can be an « excuse » to practice your French in a non-formal setting. The idea is to practice conversation with diversified topics/environments and currents events, popular culture, politics, economics, news, etc. We can also discuss French literature and newspaper/magazine articles and editorials. For instance a visit to sites of the Harlem Renaissance or Columbia University or the Jumel Mansion could be an opportunity to enrich ourselves with our mutual histories, all while conversing in French!

I have plenty of places in mind for our Voyages ! Alors a bientôt !
results.name: French conversation in NY - An Invitation to the Voyage !

results.description:
This group is for ladies in their 20s - early 30s who are in or around the Boerum Hill/Cobble Hill/Carroll Gardens area of Brooklyn and are looking for a group of friends to hang out with. I want this to be a little community of friends in our neighborhood, which can be kind of tough to find. (Sidenote: I hate the BoCoCa abbreviation, but I needed a location-specific name, so we're stuck with it unless someone thinks of something better ;).)

This is going to be super laid back and casual, so if you're in the area and want a cool bunch of girls to grab drinks with, this might be for you.  I want to keep this pretty small and local, so that you guys have a chance to actually get to know each other. Feel free to message me if you have any ideas!

As a note, the name isn't meant to be super specific - ladies from surrounding neighborhoods are totally welcome! I am trying to keep it reasonably local, though, and somewhat within the age range, as the point of this group is to create a local community near where we all live. To all of the guys out there, I'm sure you're amazing, but this group is no boys allowed. 

If you RSVPed yes to an event, but are not longer able to attend, please update your RSVP, ideally at least 24 hours in advance. If you are a no-show at two events in a row or consistently do not show up, you will be dismissed from the group and will have to reapply. 

[Note: If you are applying to join, you need to have a clear photo of yourself as your profile photo, for anti-creeper purposes.]

results.description:
https://youtu.be/TWpQDsolSoc

Calling all serious and dedicated quadcopter/multirotor FPV racers. Looking to fly courses, hold races, exchange build information, practice together and push limits.  Every meetup will involve a race course with frequency management.   

Some locations will require AMA membership.  All Team S3 official pilots have AMA and we strongly recommend you join http://www.modelaircraft.org/]

This is an FPV proximity / race course piloting community only.  Emphasis on speed, clean builds, education and 3D parts design.   Primary formats are 250/180.  Beginners are welcome. Let us help you develop good flying etiquette and good habits.  We strive to be great examples of how to be responsible pilots.  

Our very active day to day conversations are in a slack channel.  Join this meetup, fly with us at least once and you will get an invitation.  

We fly in Union, Hudson, Middlesex, Somerset and Montgomery Counties several times a week.  Join our a very active and supportive group!  


We host 3 kinds of events


• Closed Sessions - This is an internally coordinated event for existing pilots only.  We might be putting on an FPV race demo for a private group,  having a club meeting, or have a predetermined pilot list for a special event.

• Spectator Sessions - We have a predetermined pilot roster for an FPV race but the public and potential members can attend to see firsthand how are races are organized and held. 

• Open Sessions - Anyone can fly with us or attend.  Simply register for the event.  First timers will be given special instructions on how to prepare and what to expect for the first time with us.



Please visit here for more information  and our social media outlets, resources and of course, swag:

Visit our website: http://s3fpv.com/
Like us on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/s3fpv/
Race with us: http://www.multigp.com/chapters/view/...
results.name: Safety Third Racing Team - Multirotor FPV Racing

results.description: This group is for small business entrepreneurs of all types; it's about connecting LOCALLY independently-owned businesses with customers, resources and each other. We are the ONLY business alliance in the Newark area focused on SMALL businesses. Promoting, connecting, advising, advocating on YOUR behalf for greater visibility... OUR FOCUS is LOCALISM and driving $$$ and sustainability to your business. We have a signature event called the ReMIXX every month where we feature an entrepreneur. NOW we'd like to meet to determine how we can better address the opportunities and challenges of the local change maker in a more intimate setting Our Goals 1. Create a strong member network for local innovators, equip them with the resources they need to prosper, create jobs, and function in harmony with local ecosystems. 2. Keep Dollars in the Local Economy/Reduce Capital Leakage – for every $100 spent at a locally-owned business, $73 remains in the local economy, compared to that of a non-locally owned business which only retains $43. We know that entrepreneurship fuels economic innovation and prosperity, and serves as a key means for families to move out of low wage jobs and into the middle class. 3. Increase small business visibility and foster Economic Inclusion; locally owned businesses build strong communities. By sustaining vibrant communities, linking neighbors via economic and social relationships, leading to strong healthy engaged communities. Now is the time to join forces to protect, foster, and strengthen the local businesses in our neighborhoods that give us a sense of place, ensure our diverse culture, and provide us with strong unique communities we are proud to call home
results.name: Newark Forward Ever Business Alliance Meetup

results.description:
Art Fast is an experiment in cultural mapping, a way for people to experience another culture through a medium/practice that they best understand and relate to. The aim is to share the essence of Navratri, a 9-day South-East Asian Hindu festival that celebrates the divine feminine that resides within all beings. Hindus typically fast on these days and immerse themselves in spiritual practices while they engage in community interactions. As part of the cultural mapping process, artists and other creatives will rejuvenate their creative spirits (which the goddess is believed to embody) by fasting on their art practice and engaging in community sharing. 

As you ‘fast’ on your art process, you can enjoy unique South-East Asian inspired festivities in NYC and partake in events that are exclusively organized for the participants and led by acclaimed artists, e.g. art workshops, art exhibit, panel discussion etc. Art Fast is open to all professional artists and creatives (visual artists, writers, performers, filmmakers, creative directors and chefs) living anywhere in the world. If you wish to participate and attend these workshops for free please email: contact.artfast@gmail.com by Oct 10, 2015.
results.name: Rejuvenate the creative spirit in you via ART FAST

results.description:
WELCOME TO THE #1 (and only) NEW YORK ICELANDIC LANGUAGE GROUP!

This newly created Icelandic language meetup is open to those with an interest in learning Icelandic, students of the language, as well as native speakers, to join together and practice conversation, while at the same time having fun and interacting socially! 

Here you can come with any questions you have about this very unique language, and have them answered in an unstructured, fun setting - as well as getting tips and pointers on the trickier aspects of the grammar. It is also a supportive space to actually use what you've been learning with others. 

Both a study group and an opportunity for authentic conversation, this supportive and welcoming space is devoted to all Icelandic language enthusiasts!  <br>

You should consider becoming a member of the NEW YORK ICELANDIC LANGUAGE MEETUP...

• If you've brushed up a bit on your Icelandic and would like to try your hand at speaking, then this is the place to be.  

• Perhaps you're a native speaker and haven't spoken Icelandic in ages, then this is the group to join. 

• Are you are a student and would like to ask questions about a particular grammar topic? Feel free to come join us to ask those questions you may be embarrassed to raise your hand in class for.

•  Are you a language enthusiast and were always curious about Icelandic? Then this meetup is for you.

•  Even if you simply have an interest in the country and culture, come on out and join us. We're a very dedicated, energetic and passionate group! <br>

Whatever your level, from novice to native, please join us for gatherings that are casual, friendly, relaxed, and completely bilingual.  Any language enthusiast will be sure to enjoy themselves here, and what better language than Icelandic?

All levels encouraged and welcomed!
results.name: New York Icelandic Language Meetup

results.description:
Our mission: To create a vibrant entrepreneurial hub that brings together existing business owners and new entrepreneurs so that we all have a forum to engage, learn and connect with other like minded people. It is based on the belief that entrepreneurs discover solutions and grow by doing it together. 

Why should you join? Because your tired of going it alone, and realize the power of community, relationships and what we'd call the network effect.  Many of us have tried the lone wolf approach and all I can say is it's much harder in the end.

What types of events will you host?  Our focus is to bring the community a diverse offering that includes casual meetups, ideas validation and testing and of course, educational opportunities.  We're coming out of the gates here in the fall with many offerings for you to sample - stay tuned to our events page!!

What else can we tell you?  Just ask.  We're here to help you learn, grow and get the support you need to get to the next level.  We look forward to meeting up soon.

results.description: Animosos aficionados al senderismo, que deseen realizar el sendero de los Apalaches (Appalachian Trail), por secciones de uno, dos o tres días de marcha, y esporádicamente algún recorrido de mayor duración, apoyándonos recíprocamente para organizar el inicio y fin de cada trayecto. Es condición hablar o conocer al menos un poco el idioma español, y estar dispuesto a hablarlo durante la actividad, como idioma preferente. Bienvenidos los senderistas anglófonos que deseen practicar su español. Caminaremos en grupo. Es necesario que cada cual tenga su equipo mínimo personal: botas de senderismo de montaña, bastones, mochila, ropa de abrigo según cada estación del año, guantes, etc. En los recorridos de un día, caminaremos secciones de aproximadamente 10 a 14 millas, del Appalachian Trail, con muy poco peso. En los recorridos de dos o tres días, caminaremos distancias algo menores (alrededor de 8 a 10 millas diarias, dependiendo de la facilidad o dificultad de cada recorrido), con la carga mínima, necesaria para transportar el equipo de acampada personal (tienda de campaña, saco de dormir, colchoneta inflable, pequeña cocinilla, comida, agua y útiles de aseo y otros). Cuando el tamaño del grupo lo permita, y haya disponibilidad, utilizaremos también los refugios existentes a lo largo del recorrido.
results.name: New York - Senderismo en español - Appalachian Trail

results.description: Welcome everybody to the single mother sisterhood. In this group we're here to celebrate, support, and encourage single moms through the bonds of establishing a sisterhood. Whether you live in Brooklyn, Queens, Long Island or any of the boroughs for that matter you should join if you're looking for a sisterhood of single moms. This group was created by myself Jaleesa a single mom from Brooklyn and my bestie Runisha a single mom from Queens. So let's get together and have fun. We want to create a sisterhood that has something for everyone. We want to have group outings, gym days, seminars, mommy and me time, play dates, as well as mommy time. We want to not only encourage friendship but we all want to help provide support, You want to vent or get things off your chest and out your system then know that you have a sisterhood that is here and ready to listen as well as offer support and encouragement. We're all here to advocate for each other and help each other to thrive not only as moms but in life in general. It is my hope that we're all able to inspire, motivate, and empower each other. Hope to see all of you soon!!

results.description:
In addition to our semi-annual conferences, throughout the year ONUG will conduct smaller user-centered meetings across the country focused on driving open software defined cloud infrastructure. The informal meetups will provide year round opportunities for the existing ONUG Community to engage with new IT leaders and continue the discussion on topics introduced at the semi-annual conferences.

ONUG’s mission is to guide and accelerate the adoption of open software defined cloud infrastructure solutions that meet IT end user requirements as defined through use cases, proof of concepts, and deployments to ensure user needs are met. Throughout the year, ONUG meetups will be attended by members of the ONUG Board, which is comprised of representatives from Bank of America, BNY Mellon, Cigna, Citigroup, Credit Suisse, FedEx, Fidelity Investments, Gap, Inc., Intuit, JPMorgan Chase, the Lippis Report, Morgan Stanley, Pfizer, UBS, and Yahoo.  

For more information on ONUG, visit www.opennetworkingusergroup.com
results.name: ONUG Meetup

results.description:
Tea is the wine of the East. Terroir is fundamentally important.

Every tea season, founder Shunan Teng treks for three months through the backcountry of China to source our collection from 20+ historically famous tea mountains. Hailed by tea geeks around the world, Tea Drunk is a destination for those seeking exceptional tea and tea knowledge.

Tranquil and romantic, Tea Drunk serves in the brewing style that is true to the region where the tea comes from. Even if guests walk in knowing nothing about tea, they will have an unforgettable experience watching the tea prepared at table and opening their taste buds to the possibilities of terroir sourced tea, in the company of a tea pet – a clay drinking buddy.

Wannabe Music is a community project set in the New York City area for all ages that is meant to help you collaborate with other musicians and singers. Our services include a website which allows you to add or search for other musicians and singers, contact them discreetly, and help reserve spaces or hold events for musicians to play.

Our goal is to empower you to play music or sing within the community (professional or jamming), and enable you to be an expressed individual through music. Allow you to find a level of individuality that will allow you to change your life, to feel self-expressed, and enable you to live your life powerfully. 

In addition, as well as self-expression and empowering you as an individual, Wannabe Music believes playing music or singing with others allows you to work together with your community to take on whatever you want in life. You can be a source of inspiration for yourself and for others in your life as well as living your personal dreams.

results.description:
WooCommerce has emerged as the most popular method to sell online with close to 600K sites powered by WordPress and WooCommerce and over 6 million downloads. Our success has always been hinged to the amazing WordPress & WooCommerce communities.

We would love to grow our community and integrate like-minded people to talk and help each other out with everything Woo-related. Are you an avid WooCommerce enthusiast and wanting to be a part of a community of passionate developers, store owners and ecommerce specialists? We’d love you to get involved in organising our WooCommerce meetups all over the globe.

Meetups are meant to benefit the local WooCommerce community through live events and the broader WordPress community through the sharing of knowledge.

In the past year we’ve crept more and more out of our cyber shell and attended an increasing amount of WordPress events and ecommerce events. The response to all things WooCommerce has been tremendous but the need users have for collaboration and assistance is abundant. We recognize that their are limitations to what we can do for our users on WooThemes.com and thus want to create space for users (developers and store owners) to connect, help one another and see what emerges. Simply put, amazing things happen when people come together.
results.name: New York WooCommerce Meetup

There are hundreds of new sweepstakes, contests, and giveaways being created every single day that can net you thousands of dollars a year in prizes. Group members will share their techniques and strategies for finding, applying for, and increasing their odds of winning legitimate giveaways while avoiding scams. All you'll need is some time, a connection to the Internet, and occasionally stamps/envelopes/paper (required only for a small percentage of sweepstakes).

topics.name: Exploring The World - Traveling and Excursions

results.description:
So with 8.4+ million people in NYC, I find it very difficult to believe that I am the only Christian teacher who happens LOVE traveling. I don't want to sound selfish or spoiled but I travel whenever I have off from work. As a teacher, my schedule for time off is built into the year (I have no control of when I have time off and I know my schedule a year in a advance). I love teaching as I know it's a job I was called to do. I've been an Early Childhood Special Education teacher for the past 6 years. I love teaching AND traveling but unfortunately, get to do the majority of it alone. Sometimes, for certain excursions or activities, it's better to go with someone. I tend to have more fun being around people. The perk of traveling alone is that you get to meet so many cool people from around the world but I wondered if there were others like me that I can travel with? I don't smoke, drink or curse and during my travels I have come to realize that I stand out, just by not doing any of the above. I get asked about it and explain that I simply have no reason to do so (I could explain Romans 12:2, but I'm not sure they'll understand.) Some respect it and many do not. So maybe there are teachers like me out there (WHERE ARE YOU?), who have the time, interest and money to travel and want to do it with like-minded individuals! Let's travel together and not be conformed to this world BUT see the beautiful world God has created!!! There's so much out there to see and I've only touched 9% of the countries in this world. I have a lot more traveling to do!! http://www.travbuddy.com/maps/6880222

Will you Join?
results.name: Christian Traveling Educators

The Temple Isaiah Young Professionals Group consists of young, Jewish young professionals (in our 20s, 30s and 40s) located in or the around Great Neck, NY area. Thegroup is affiliated with Temple of Isaiah of Great Neck, a reform congregation off of Cutter Mill Road in Great Neck. Temple Isaiah is a warm, welcoming, non-judgmental community of friends that welcomes all who seek a Jewish experience. 

The goal of our group is to foster an interactive community of young, Jewish professionals who wish to participate in a variety of activities at three levels: 1) primarily, social activities; 2) social action activities (in a way to give back to the local and even broader community); and 3) Jewish learning events (including a variety of classes, films and outings). 

For additional information feel free to send your inquiries to: templeisaiahyoungprofessionals@gmail.com or feel free to leave a message any time on our Meetup site. 

We hope to talk to you and see you soon!

results.description:
My name is Kenti.  If you are like me, you have dreamed of making truly great music with an amazing band of musicians that you got together.  I started this group to make your dream and my dream a reality.  Right now! 

We are creating an environment that supports each person discovering and honing our own greatness and the greatness in others.  This environment will allow people to support each other in all aspects of getting a band started, and making them successful:  Finding the right band members, building our chops, managing rehearsals, concert performances, recordings, marketing, learning the music business and getting paid for our work.  In other words doing what you love and getting paid for it.

This is not going to be your ordinary meetup group.  If you're up to participating and taking your BEST SHOT at making something great happen, I Invite you to join this group.

I am an experienced Guitarist (Jazz, Blues, Rock, Folk, R&B, Reggae), Music Teacher, Composer, Recording Engineer, and Business Manager and all-around problem solver.  I've been in bands, and currently perform solo gigs around New York and New Jersey.  I've taught guitar and piano for over 17 years. For practice, I often perform in the NYC Subway; I use those performances to invent and develop new musical ideas in front of the commuting audience.  This has already contributed to the recording of CD collection of my original music.

Your age is not important.  We will have bands with young musicians, bands with older musicians, bands with young and old mixed, and everything in between.  Come as you are - No one will be left behind!
results.name: Starting a Great Band

results.description: This is a group for women who are interested in learning more about nontoxic beauty, body, and cleaning products. We live in a world where exposure to toxic chemicals can feel difficult to escape (especially in NYC!!) so it is important to make improvements in places where we do have control. We can make smarter choices for our own bodies, our families, and in our homes. Luckily there is a growing number of safe alternatives available, and many are just as effective, if not more so, than their drugstore equivalents. I want to create a community where we can learn from one another and share ideas, hopefully meeting once a month or more. I have a lot of information to share about high performing safe products, as well as things you can create in your own kitchen. results.description: Pecha Kucha ペチャクチャ , or “chit chat” in Japanese, is a concise presentation style, comprised of twenty slides at a duration of twenty seconds each that advance automatically. This format, devised by Klein Dytham Architecture, powers multi-speaker events called Pecha Kucha Nights. PKNs invite creatives of all fields to meet, present projects, and exchange ideas in 750+ cities around the world. Pecha Kucha has a global reputation for an eclectic mix of artists, activists, musicians, comedians, designers, architects, filmmakers, photographers, writers, mountaineers, et al coming together to make their patented Pecha Kucha presentation in front of an attentive, appreciative, and appropriately lubricated audience. For presenters and spectators alike, these are always great evenings.
results.name: Pecha Kucha Night Brooklyn

results.description:
This meetup group is the New York chapter of Medicine X (http://medicinex.stanford.edu). Medicine X is a catalyst for new ideas about the future of medicine and health care. The initiative explores how emerging technologies will advance the practice of medicine, improve health, and empower patients to be active participants in their own care. Such emerging technologies include those that are:

• largely digital (e.g., online peer-to-peer healthcare communities, wearables);

• methodological (e.g., human-centered design and innovation, service design);

• cultural (e.g., participatory medicine, doctors and patients functioning as designers);

• and more.

This group is intended to bring together (e)patients, healthcare providers, experience designers, technologists, and researchers. The group will offer opportunities to hear from key members of these communities, experience emerging technologies, collaborate on projects, and more.

Contact the organizer(s) if you want to volunteer to speak at a meeting or recommend speakers. Contact the organizer(s) also if you are interested in providing a venue for meetings or in being a meetup sponsor, or if you would like to recommend possibilities for either.
results.name: Medicine X - New York Area

results.description:
-Are you a pretty self-aware person and yet you and your partner still get swept up in bitter fights that leave you feeling hurt and disconnected? 

-Or maybe one of you gets needy and demanding and the other partner withdraws? 

-Or maybes it seems that your partner doesn’t care about your needs and you’re living like roommates instead of soul mates? 

-Do you feel unappreciated, misunderstood, or rejected? 

Issues like these are normal in long term relationships, and there ARE proven strategies to turn your relationship around, to experience love, intimacy, and passion again! 

In this group we learn how to transform conflict into intimacy with the guidance of Relationship Coach Valerie Greene, and we share mutual support, so we can deepen our love relationships. 

Here, you'll find your community who are going through similar challenges in their relationships, and it's helpful to know that you're not alone, isn't it? I know I could have used a group like this when I chose to transform my relationship.

As of now, for a limited time, membership in this meetup is completely free, and admission to our meetings is free as well, because we want to get this information out to as many people as possible.
results.name: Deepen Your Love Relationship

topics.name: Love Yourself and Attract True Love

results.description:
Have you been craving true love, a long term relationship, soulmate love and/or lasting love? Have you noticed patterns in your relationships that you'd like to change? Do you want healthier, happier relationships where a) you treat yourself better and b) your partner treats you better? Do you want to read Calling In The One by Katherine Woodward Thomas?

The point of this meet-up group is to read through the Calling In The One book (CITO for short), do the exercises and check in every week and keep ourselves on track - going through one chapter every week or two, depending on how ambitious we're feeling. The book is 8 chapters including the introduction. We'll meet once a week and discuss what we've read, how the exercises went & what we're learning about ourselves, our progress & our patterns in relationships. This meet-up is open to men & women. About you: you're committed to showing up consistently (missing 1 or 2 weeks at most) & you're someone who finishes what you start.

results.description:
Developing an Attractive Mindset Do you have any social phobia that just doesn't allow your attractive self to come out? I grew up with crazy social phobias which wouldn't allow myself to express my true personality. 

Let's face it, most of us live in our heads and we are slaves to that voice. I was fortunate to live with a life coach in personal development and learnt how to develop natural confidence by learning how to talk to MYSELF better. To become comfortable in social situations, is to develop a strong relationship with your OWN self. 

This meetup is based on: 

• Talks and discussions on social phobia behaviors such as Dealing with and Overcoming rejection Approval Seeking Social Anxiety Overly Self-conscious (especially with the opposite sex) Fear other people will judge Constant comparison to others 

• Action steps and Drills to help kill "social phobia" behavior 

• Exercises you can do at home to strengthen the relationship with yourself.

***Events and talks will be catered to  men or women,  and sometimes both***
results.name: Developing The Attractive Mindset

results.description:
For those who find the idea of a virgin birth mind-numbing, the concept of "original sin" brain-straining, or an all-powerful and loving, yet jealous and vindictive, deity problematic, we invite you to spend time with similarly thinking folks.

HopeLines, a non-denominational and utterly, non-traditional church, offers an alternative to the traditional religious overhead of blind faith, endless guilt, and questionable rationality. We focus on the wisdom teachings attributed to the ancient sages. With 78% of the American population purporting some measure of Christianity, HopeLines includes, but is not limited to, the discourses ascribed to Jesus.

Our appeal is to those for whom spiritual freedom trumps religious restraints, and the notion of God is not taboo, supernatural, human-like, or humanized.

Through the precepts of ancient sages such as Lao Tzu, Siddhartha Gautama, Ptah-hotep, and Jesus (to name a few), HopeLines' mission is to encourage ways of thinking and living that:

● Build and maintain our birthright of excellent character.

● Embody active compassion as a celebration of life and living.

● Practice innate wisdom as our alignment with the God within and without.

● Unite Mind and Spirit to actualize our awesome potential.

"We believe that our goal is to meld with the powerful, yet subtle, law of our existence:" says Rev. Alexander, facilitator of HopeLines Church, "the law of cause and effect. Some call it God."

ABOUT HopeLines

HopeLines is a non-denominational, non-traditional church. Focused on living clearly, cleanly, and wisely, HopeLines awakens and celebrates the God in us all.  (Read more at our website, http://hopelines.org.)
results.name: New York Spiritual Growth Meetup

topics.name: Social Networking for Mental Health Professionals

results.description:
This meet up is for mental health professionals (counselors, social workers, psychologists, students, etc.) in the NJ/NY area looking to connect - and unwind - with like-minded folks!

Though working in the mental health field is incredibly gratifying, it can also be draining. Self-care is a crucial piece of being a successful professional, so why not work toward avoiding burn out (and having fun!) together?

Meet-ups are "fun" events, like happy hours, potlucks, etc., though peer supervision/clinical case sharing may be added depending upon the interests/needs of members.

All ages, genders, orientations, etc. are welcome!


**PLEASE NOTE: THIS MEET-UP IS FOR PROFESSIONALS/STUDENTS AND THEIR +1'S ONLY! Though interest in the mental health field is very much appreciated, this meet-up is NOT for psychology/mental health enthusiasts and/or those looking for support.**
results.name: The therapist is...out!

results.description:
Franglish is an unique and innovative French/English and Spanish/English language exchange event taking place every week from 7 to 9pm in some of the best venues across New York City.

Franglish organises events in more than 10 cities in France and in the UK (and now in the USA) and our community has more than 50 000 members. Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/LanguageExchangeNewYork

Practicing is the best way to learn a language and you'll discover French/Spanish/English culture with locals and foreigners. FREE events (tip supported, give what you want at the end of the event).

Over 30 people attend each event. Your French/Spanish/English doesn't have to be perfect, a lot of people come who speak very little French/Spanish/English.

Discover Franglish and its unique format of 1-to-1 conversations that last for 14 minutes (7 min in English, 7 min in French or Spanish), that gives you the opportunity to meet many native speakers. But Franglish doesn’t just stop there. Ask around – you’ll find that many people find their friends at Franglish.
results.name: French/English and Spanish/English Language Exchange in NYC

Presentation Leader Katie Maroldi: 

Prior to joining Jersey Girl Creative this young dynamo started Mo’s Media, a Social Media Marketing company, from the ground up.

Katie is a born leader: from Pace University Graduate in Communications and Public Relations to Social Media Director at Prana Marketing, a boutique marketing and public relations firm, Katie is at the helm of Jersey Girls Creative’s social media marketing and campaigns.

Katie Maroldi has also worked directly with SCORE, a national non-profit organization dedicated to helping emerging and existing small businesses maximize their potential for success, as a Social Media Workshop presenter.

Prior to Prana Marketing, Katie interned at several New York City PR firms specializing in consumer product marketing, Broadway shows, celebrities, and theater, creating grass roots digital marketing campaigns. There is no challenge too big or too small for Katie and she will find a solution to flawlessly execute any marketing initiative.

Hello, Chinese, Japanese or Korean (CJK) language Masters!

Note: Please include a real, clear photo of yourself. Fake, or pictures of animals or objects will not be allowed and you will not be approved. Thank you for your cooperation.

 Have you taken all the language classes in CJK or ESL but still find hard to actually practice with other native speakers in the language of interest? Do you seek a real world setting where you can find CJK and English speaking bilingual people in which you can gain practice partners and lifelong friendships/relationships? Are you new to American or NYC? Are you American but proficient in one of the CJK languages because of your parent’s culture and ethnicity? Have you worked abroad in one of the CJK countries?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then this meetup is for you. We hold bi-weekly or monthly social events at bars, lounges, and rooftops around NYC. You will feel invigorated to explore the city and practice your languages and culture in real time. Membership is FREE! All level of learners are welcome: from beginner to advanced learners or native speakers of Chinese (Mandarin or Cantonese), Japanese, Korean or English are welcome. Here, you will make a lot of language exchange friends here and practice partners.

Come join us at our next social event and party by signing up!
results.name: Chinese, Japanese, Korean in Practice (Night-Life Edition)

results.description: This group is for private companies in New York with the infrastructure, assets and vision to succeed that could also benefit from additional support in: 1) Identifying appropriate pools of capital to fund the continued growth of their businesses 2) Attaining introductions to potential strategic partners 3) Inking relationships to pursue mergers, acquisitions and/or sales 4) Attaining strategic advice for maximizing shareholder value and/or monetizing assets.  Wall Street Share was formed on the premise that there are a plethora of private companies with significant potential that are unable to identify the capital and/or strategic relationships required to make their businesses successful -- oftentimes a capital infusion or valuable introduction makes all the difference in dictating the course of a venture. Please see our website (www.wallstreetshare.com) for more information on our company and philosophy.  We thoroughly enjoy meeting leaders who are involved in interesting endeavors, learning about their businesses and helping them. We formed this group to reach out to managers involved in businesses in which they are passionate, and we envision creating an ecosystem of promising and innovative companies that are keen on sharing ideas, discussing their stories and needs and attaining the assistance they require to succeed.

results.description:
Each Suppers meeting has its own purpose and personality. There are only three non-negotiable principles common to all meetings: 

1. that we all actively practice non-judgment 

2. that we all prepare meals from single, whole, fresh foods with very limited processed food 

3. that we all avoid commercial messages and the promotion of any particular diet, product or service 

Beyond that, facilitators create meetings based on their own particular passions, be it teaching people to prepare raw vegan meals, to managing or reversing diabetes through lifestyle change, to teaching people how to transition the family taste buds from junk to healthy food. We do this by creating safe and friendly settings where people with food-related health challenges can develop and manage their own personal transition to a healthier lifestyle. We focus on preparing healthy mood-stabilizing meals from whole foods, including easy one-pot meals like soups, stews, chili, salads, and slaws. Forge new friendships and get support based on healthy living.  The program is free to users except for the shared cost of the meal, about $15/meeting. Feel free to visit our main website for additional information and other meetings not posted on MeetUp.com - www.thesuppersprograms.org

Please note that active participation in Suppers Meetups is required to be a continuing member.  The goals of the program cannot be achieved if you cannot attend in person.  Cooking, eating, and meeting together is the underlying foundation of Suppers.  So if you are unable to attend 3 meetings in a 12 month period, you will be removed from the Meetup.  You are free to rejoin when your schedule permits your presence at meetings.
results.name: Vegan Suppers in the Bronx

Your thoughts are welcome to the group in what YOU want to discuss, how YOU want to express yourself, and how WE can create a bond that unites us in this group- and that is the pregnancy and postpartum experience. results.description:
The Art League of the Chathams (ALC) is a supportive community of visual artists living in the Chatham area of NJ. The League's mission is to nurture the artistic development of its members and to foster an appreciation of their work in the community. League membership is open to visual artists and art enthusiast who live in Chatham Township, Chatham Borough and near-by towns.

The major role of ALC is to exhibit members’ art work at the Chatham Township Municipal Building (at 58 Meyersville Road) and at the Chatham Borough Municipal Building (at 54 Fairmount Ave). ALC members also have opportunities to display their work at other venues in the area. 

Current members of Art League of the Chathams (ALC) can automatically join the group for free as long as their dues are up to date. 

Don't know our group and are you interested in our events? JOIN US on this site and follow the direction how to become ALC member. ALC membership dues are $20 for an individual, $30 for a couple/family annually. Detailed information regarding benefits and how to pay the dues can be found on our website. http://www.artleagueofthechathams.org/id6.h... or on this site under "More" and "Files" ('Benefits' file and 'Join' file). Artist who are not current members and would like to join have 60 days trial period. Once you send in your dues, your profile will state "exempt from dues".  

Important: Please DO NOT pay trough Meetup service. The ALC meetup site is managed by an individual person and the payment would be send to her. The payment NEEDS TO BE SENT to ALC treasurer as described in links/file.  

For more detailed information please visit our website at: www.artleagueofthechathams.org
results.name: Art League of the Chathams     ALC

results.description:
We are a self-organizing group of practitioners, inspired by Frederic Laloux's book "Reinventing Organizations", committed to supporting organizations and leadership to evolve and embody the qualities of "Teal" - Self-Management, Evolutionary Purpose, and Wholeness.

We will be exploring the ideas, principles, and practices from Laloux's book, as well as other related material, through facilitated conversations and exercises. We will often use tools and methods from the Art of Hosting, a collaborative approach to participatory leadership and decision-making. Our members are invited and encouraged to show up with their curiosity and excitement and to find ways to contribute to our budding community.

Through our meetings we hope to provide the soil (community) in which new seeds (ideas) can be planted, fertilized, and nourished, eventually growing to become healthy expressions of creativity (projects) that connect and support each other to give rise to a new eco-system (social structures).

Join us if you are:

• frustrated with the current way that your organization operates in terms of meetings, management, strategy, and execution, and you know there must be a better way;

• passionate about unleashing the potential of business as a force for good and aligning enterprise with purpose;

• sensing that there is a significant shift occurring in our social systems and wondering how it applies to organizations and how you can contribute to the transition;

• looking to connect with like-minded individuals who are also working to make our organizations function in a more healthy, dynamic, and life-affirming way
results.name: Teal Organizations NYC Community of Practice

results.description:
This is an acoustic instrumental slow jam focusing on tunes in the following traditions: Irish, English, New England Old Time, French Canadian, American Southern, and maybe even Scandinavian. Tunes are those that are typically suitable for contra dancing or other traditional fiddle tunes. This group is intended to provide a musical home for folks interested in playing tunes with other musicians, learning to play by ear and overall increasing their own musical skill. It’s fun and welcoming to all ages (see venue for 21+ restrictions) and levels of playing. 

What do we mean by SLOW JAM? All acoustic instruments (e.g., fiddle, mandolin, guitar, cello, etc.) are welcome and we play songs that typically follow the AABB format (two “A” parts followed by two “B” parts) and we will simply play it over many repeats and if you know it, great (!), but if you don’t, you try to figure it out as we go along, maybe picking up a few notes here and there.  There's no pressure, but it can be a challenge!

All levels? Yes! This jam will be at a speed that is accessible to advanced beginner, but welcome to all levels.

Please click on the "Pages" tab for more a more detailed description.
results.name: Brooklyn Traditional Slow Jam

The Shredshare Team

Access | Community | Conservation

results.description: Pickup Soccer NYC held its first games in Summer 2006 and was the first, organized pickup soccer organization to exist in NYC. PSNYC is a co-ed, recreational soccer group playing organized soccer games in Manhattan and Brooklyn year-round. The group comes together around playing the sport for fun, not competition and we do not keep score at games. Our games are informal and recreational with an emphasis on NON-competitive play. PICKUP SOCCER NYC is an organized, co-ed recreational group that holds open soccer games year-round several days a week at playing fields across Manhattan. All games are held on full-sized grass/turf playing fields with anywhere from 12-30 players per given game. Attendance is optional once you sign up and you can attend as few or as many games as you wish. The group is composed of players of all ages, backgrounds and nationalities. We are not a league nor do we use refs or officials. We moderate games ourselves making our own calls. We do not keep score. The group is open to all skill levels and our membership encompasses a mix of playing experience and abilities - from beginner to former pro.
results.name: PSNYC / Pickup Soccer NYC Soccer - Meetup Group

results.description:
Want to lose weight with a structured program that is SIMPLE to follow? It results in fast, safe, and predictable weight loss! Let's experience the journey TOGETHER! I am a Registered Dietitian-Nutritionist and Certified Health Coach- I have THE solution for you and will provide support every step of the way!! We will meet/talk on a regular basis to keep us all moving in the right direction and to celebrate our successes in a supportive and empathetic environment.  In our meetings, we will focus on the many Habits of Health to get you where you want to go!

Who should join?  If you are looking to lose weight, get healthier, increase your energy, reduce medications, reduce stress and have support from a coach and group while doing it, this group is for you!

Why?  Nothing promotes long-term success like a supportive environment where you can share your successes and challenges without being judged.  This model and program work amazingly for that reason. 

Purpose: To bring people together who have a shared mission of getting healthy and losing weight, and learning together and from each other!

results.description:
This is a group for any adults, professionals, and graduate students who want to learn more about Adult ADD and ADHD. Getting information, advice, and support from others coping with the challenges of Adult ADD is a powerful way to start overcoming your own challenges with time management, project planning, organization, and procrastination. We know because we have been there. 

This education forum is intended to bring together adults and professionals so they don't have to deal with ADD alone and can find others who understand and identify rather than judge and lecture. The group is run by two clinical psychologists with over 20 years of experience helping adults and professionals in the NYC area thrive at work and home despite their ADD symptoms. We have also struggled with our own ADD symptoms and learned ways to compensate through the support and help of others.  Join us for an informative, empowering experience at the Center for Optimal Performance conveniently located by all major transit hubs in Midtown Manhattan.
results.name: Adults and Professionals with ADD or ADHD

2) Each attendee has the option to "ask anything" That is present 1 photograph of anything and ask and/or show anything about it.

results.description:
Hi my name is Monifa and I am a self-professed Francophile. For years I've traveled to France trying to improve my French only to lose most of it when I returned to New York. Well, I've decided to change that...I'm starting the Harlem French Club! 

Have you ever wished that you would have stuck with your high school or college French classes so that you would now be fluent? Hmmm, did you let that dream of being fluent fade away because you didn't have anyone to practice with? Do you know that there are 38 countries outside of France where French is the official language....think of all the possibilities where you can speak French while traveling around the world to enrich your cultural experience! That's freaking huge!! (C'est freaking énorme!!) 

The Harlem French Club will meetup to learn and practice speaking French; learn about French culture in France, as well as learn about the countries where French is the official language…..including the 26 countries in Africa!!! Having spent time in West African French speaking countries, this will be an interesting and exciting experience.

The Harlem French Club will also go to movies, restaurants; cultural events around the city and meet native speakers from around the francophone world!

Merci et j'espère vous voir bientôt!

Monifa
results.name: The Harlem French Club

results.description:
FOREVER YOUNG (45ish) AFRICAN AMERICAN  CLUB.

FOREVER YOUNG!! 
This Club was created  to encourage  Men and Women (45 years and older)to get out of the house, meet new people, socialize, and enjoy life to the fullest. We want members to have a sense of belonging. A Club that meets 1-2 times per month with liked minded and interest minded members. Our goal is to enjoy life NOW.


All are welcome to join. Please join us if you would like to meet other  African American  in the Metro Area and Beyond.

Men/women/seniors/ visitors/tourist/ retirees/professionals/entrepreneurs/community group members/ church group members/employed/unemployed/etc.
If you are looking to make friends with fun loving and positive people, then this is the Club for you.


Events and Activities of  Cultural interest:

The City has a lot to offer and we are going to explore all the City's hidden gems.

Concerts/plays/party get together/ trips/cruises/ community events/park events/movies/church events/boat rides/family events/casino/bingo/tennis/ seminars/lunch/ brunch/movie/spoken word/adult round table talk/ travel/etc. The possibilities are endless.


 DON’T LET MONEY STOP YOU FROM JOINING!
We’ll search for discounts that are available to our group members.
(Senior discounts, group discounts, coupon programs, club discount program, restaurant discounts, etc.


SUGGESTIONS ARE WELCOME!!

If you have a suggestion for an event, please share .
If you have information of a discount program , please share it with the group. We're here to make friends, participate, save money whenever possible and have lots of fun. 


 REQUIREMENTS:
All members are required to participate in events as often as possible. The more times the better.

Club will meet 1-2 times per Month. This will give members enough time to plan for  events.

 
RULES AND REGULATIONS:
1) An Annual Membership Dues of $8:00  are required before or after the Trial period. (Trial Period 14 days).  Dues are Once per year. However,FOR 1ST EVENT, DUES ARE REQUIRED.

2) Annual Payments are accepted in person or online. (Once per year).
3) Dues help to defray the cost to Meetup.com, purchasing membership in discount clubs, and organizing the monthly operation of this Club
4) Please be mindful of Organizers time and effort.
5) Please be courteous to all Club Members.
6) A NO SHOW after RSVP is not acceptable. You’ll be REMOVED after 2 NO SHOWS.
7) Lateness is not acceptable.
8) Please remember that I value  YOU. You’ll always feel welcome in this Club..

 
Thank you for your support.
I hope to meet you at an event soon.

 
PLEASE JOIN TODAY!
Best regards.
Laurel
results.name: FOREVER YOUNG (45ish) AFRICAN AMERICAN   CLUB

results.description:
Business Developers of Morristown welcomes business representatives and business owners to join in every Wednesday morning as we work to build relationships that lead to increased business through warm referrals and introductions. The group was established 10+ years ago and typically has 20-40 business professionals in attendance every week. Stop by for breakfast at the Hanover Marriott, bring a thick stack of business cards with you, and make more quality professional contacts in the local community. This is a great way to get visibility for you and your business locally as it's somewhat like having a sales/marketing/mentoring/resource team! 

We are BNI-affiliated, value the philosophy of "Givers Gain", and are committed to helping one another succeed. BNI chapters are allowed to have only one profession to avoid conflict - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business - effectively locking out the competition. Please feel free to contact us to see if your category is currently open in our chapter! To see which categories we already have filled go to our BNI Website

We are actively looking for the following categories: Advertising, Air/Water Purification, Alternative Energy, Architect, Carpet Cleaner, Florist,  Payroll Service, Restoration Damage and Cleanup.

For more information on BNI, visit their website.
results.name: BNI Business Developers of Morristown

You will learn about your first impression and what you're communicating that perhaps you're not aware that you're communicating. Are you insecure, but read as arrogant? Do you smile with openness, but use a shy voice? Align your intention and your presentation. Empower yourself with knowledge on how to be your most authentic self and finally land the one you love.
